english: Whoever writes this Queen of Spells, Sitātapatrā Born from the Uṣṇīṣa of All Thus-gone Ones, Great Invincible Dispeller, on birch bark, cloth, or tree bark and wears it on their body or around their neck, or reads it, that person will not be harmed by toxins, weapons, fire, water, metal poisoning, poison, or sorcery for as long as they live. They will never meet an untimely death. They will become dear to all grahas, obstructors, and false guides. The eighty-four billion vidyā-goddesses of the vajra family will always guard, protect, and defend them. They will become dear to these goddesses. They will recall their rebirths of the past eighty-four thousand great eons. The sixty-four dūtī goddesses will always completely defend them. They will never take birth as yakṣas, rākṣasas, pretas, piśācas, pūtanas, or kaṭapūtanas. They will never be poor. They will gain heaps of merit equal to the blessed buddhas who are innumerable like the grains of sand in the river Ganges. The blessed buddhas and bodhisattvas, innumerable as the grains of sand in the river Ganges, will always guard, protect, and defend them. They will become the children of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

transliteration: dezhin shekpa tamché kyi tsuktor né jungwé dukkar pochen zhen gyi mi tubpa zhejawé chirdok pé rik ngak kyi gyalmo di chang na tsangpar mi chöpa yang tsangpar chöpar gyur ro tubpar majepa yang tubpar jepar gyur ro mi tsangwa yang tsangwar gyur ro nyungwa majepa yang nyungwa jepar gyur ro tsammepa nga jepa yang jangwar gyur ro ngön gyi lé kyi dribpa yang malüpar zepar gyur ro
english: Whoever bears this Queen of Vidyā-mantras, Great Dispeller of Invincible Might, called ‘Sitātapatrā Born from the Uṣṇīṣa of All Tathāgatas,’ will become chaste, even if they not celibate. Those who are not ascetics will be ascetics. Though impure, they will become pure. Though they neglect fasting, they will start to observe the fast. Even for those who they have committed the five crimes with immediate retribution, their crimes will be purified. All their obscurations resulting from their past actions will be exhausted without exception.

transliteration: rik kyi bu am rik kyi bumo bu döpa gang lalé dezhin shekpé tsuktor né jungwé dukkar pochen chirdok pa chenmo rik ngak kyi gyalmo di chang ngam lok na bu döpa dé bu nyé dé tsé dang sönam dang tob kyang rabtu nyé do di né shi pö né kyang jikten gyi kham dewachen du kyewar gyur ro
english: If my noble sons or daughters wish to have children and bear or recite this Queen of Vidyā-mantras, Sitātapatrā Born from the Uṣṇīṣa of All Tathāgatas, Great Dispeller, they will produce an heir. Furthermore, their lifespan, merit, and strength will increase. After they have passed away, they will take birth in the blissful realm of Sukhāvatī.

tibetan: མི་ནད་དང༌། ཕྱུགས་ནད་དང༌། ཡམས་ཀྱི་ནད་དང༌། འཚེ་བ་དང༌། གནོད་པ་དང༌། ནད་འགོ་བ་དང༌། འཁྲུག་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་དང༌། ཕ་རོལ་གྱི་དམག་ཚོགས་འོང་བ་ཐམས་ཅད་ལ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་གཙུག་ཏོར་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་གདུགས་དཀར་པོ་ཅན་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་གཞན་གྱིས་མི་ཐུབ་པ་ཕྱིར་ཟློག་པའི་རིག་སྔགས་ཀྱི་རྒྱལ་མོ་འདི་རྒྱལ་མཚན་གྱི་རྩེ་མོ་ལ་བཏགས་ཏེ། རིམ་གྲོ་ཆེར་བྱས་ཏེ་མཆོད་པ་ཆེན་པོ་བྱས་ལ་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱི་སྒོའམ། གྲོང་ངམ། གྲོང་ཁྱེར་རམ། གྲོང་བརྡལ་ལམ། ལྗོངས་སམ། དགོན་པའི་གནས་སུ་གཟུགས་སོ། །འཕགས་པ་གཞན་གྱིས་མི་ཐུབ་པ་ཕྱིར་ཟློག་མ་ཆེན་མོ་རིག་སྔགས་ཀྱི་རྒྱལ་མོ་འདི་རིམ་གྲོ་ཆེར་བྱས་ཏེ་བཙུགས་ན་བཙུགས་མ་ཐག་ཏུ་གཡུལ་ཞི་བར་བྱས་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། །ཡམས་ཀྱི་ནད་དང༌། འཚེ་བ་དང༌། གནོད་པ་དང༌། ནད་འགོ་བ་དང༌། འཁྲུག་པ་དང༌། ཕ་རོལ་གྱི་དམག་ཚོགས་ཐམས་ཅད་རབ་ཏུ་ཞི་བར་འགྱུར་རོ། །
transliteration: miné dang chukné dang yam kyi né dang tsewa dang nöpa dang né gowa dang trukpa tamché dang parol gyi mak tsok ongwa tamché la dezhin shekpé tsuktor né jungwé dukkar pochen zhejawa zhen gyi mi tubpa chirdok pé rik ngak kyi gyalmo di gyaltsen gyi tsemo latak té rimdro cher jé té chöpa chenpo jé la drongkhyer tamché kyi go am drong ngam drongkhyer ram drong dal lam jong sam gönpé né su zuk so pakpa zhen gyi mi tubpa chirdok machen mo rik ngak kyi gyalmo di rimdro cher jé té tsuk na tsuk ma tak tu yul zhiwar jepar gyur ro yam kyi né dang tsewa dang nöpa dang né gowa dang trukpa dang parol gyi mak tsok tamché rabtu zhiwar gyur ro
english: Whoever is threatened by diseases that affect humans or animals, by epidemics, violence, harm, infectious diseases, any kind of quarrels, and any approaching rival armies, should affix this Queen of Vidyā-mantras, the Great Dispeller of Invincible Might called ‘Sitātapatrā Born from the Uṣṇīṣa of All Tathāgatas,’ to the top of victory banners. Once extensive worship has been performed with great offerings, the banners should be hoisted at all gateways to the city, or temple, or village, or town, or province, or capital, or charnel ground, or mountain or monastery. As soon as the rituals for this noble Queen of Spells, Great Invincible Dispeller, have been completed and the banner hoisted, war will be pacified. All epidemics, violence, harm, infectious diseases, quarrels, and approaching rival armies will be completely quelled.

transliteration: teyata | om trom bendha bendha mama raksha raksha soha | om trom bendha bendha benza mama raksha raksha benza pani hung pé soha | om sarva tatagatoshnisha analé avalokité tsurnaté dzarayi | om dzala dzala | dhaka dhaka | dhara dhara | bidara bidara | tsinda tsinda | bhinda bhinda | hung hung pé pé soha | om sarva tatagatoshnisha hung pé soha |
english: tadyathā | oṃ ṣṭom bandha bandha mama rāḳsa rāḳsa svāhā || oṃ ṣṭoṃ bandha bandha vajra mama rāḳsa rāḳsa vajrapāṇi hūṃ phaṭ svāhā || oṃ sarva-tathāgatoṣṇīṣānale avalokite curṇate jvarāśi || oṃ jvala jvala dhaka dhaka dhara dhara vidhara vidhara cchinda cchinda bhindha bhindha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā || oṃ sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣa hūṃ phaṭ svāhā ||

transliteration: teyata | om analé analé | khasamé khasa mé | bairé bairé | saumé saumé | sarva buddha adhishtina adhishtité sarva tatagatoshnisha sita tapatré hung pé | hung ma ma hung ni soha |
english: tadyathā | oṃ anale anale | khasame khasame | vaire vaire | saumye saumye | sarva-buddhādiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhite sarva-tathāgatoṣṇīṣa-sitātapatre hūṃ phaṭ | hūṃ ma ma hūṃ ni svāhā ||

transliteration: lü gyalpo tayé dang lü gyalpo dungkyong dang lü gyalpo nakpo chenpo nam kyi dü dü su charbeb so dü dü su trin dü do dü dü su druk gi dra drokpar gyur ro
english: The nāga-kings Ananta, Śaṅkhapāla, and Mahākṛṣṇa will send rain, clouds, and thunder in a timely manner.

transliteration: nyewar tsewa tamché la sangye kyi naljor du jé la len sum depar ja o
english: For any type of danger this should be recited three times with the yoga of the Buddha.

tibetan: སངས་རྒྱས་དང༌། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་རྣམས་དང༌། ལྷ་དང༌། མི་དང༌། ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དང༌། དྲི་ཟར་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་ཡི་རངས་ཏེ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པ་ལ་མངོན་པར་བསྟོད་དོ། །
transliteration: sangye dang changchub sempa nam dang lha dang mi dang lha mayin dang drizar chepé jikten yirang té chomdendé kyi sungpa la ngönpar tö do
english: The buddhas and bodhisattvas, together with the whole world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the speech of the Blessed One.

transliteration: pakpa dezhin shekpé tsuktor né jungwa dukkar pochen zhen gyi mi tubpa chenmo chirdok pa chok tu drubpa zhejawé zung dzok so
english: Thus concludes the noble dhāraṇī “The Supreme Accomplishment of Sitātapatrā Born from the Tathāgata’s Uṣṇīṣa, Great Invincible Dispeller.”

transliteration: könchok sum la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Three Jewels!

transliteration: nöjin gyi depön chenpo lak na dorjé gö ngönpochen
english: Homage to the overlord of yakṣas,1 Blue-Clad Vajrapāṇi,

transliteration: sangye gang gé lung gi jema nyé kyi jesu nangwa
english: Authorized by as many Buddhas as grains of sand in the river Ganges,

transliteration: chewa tsikpa dang tsampa
english: You who appear baring your fangs;

transliteration: mik medak gi pungpo drawa
english: You whose eyes are like masses of flames;

transliteration: uk meché tar barwa
english: You whose breath blazes with fiery tongues;

transliteration: jikpé ngaro chen
english: You whose roar terrifies;

transliteration: lakpa dang kangpa lu nor gyé kyi bü gyenpa
english: You whose hands and legs are adorned with the nāga Vāsuki;

transliteration: lu nakpo seral khar tokpa
english: You who sport the nāga Kāla as a sash;

transliteration: lu gawo dang nyé gawo barwé na cha jepa
english: You who make the nāgas Nanda and Upananda your earrings;

transliteration: drul barwé rinpoche chöpen tokpa
english: You who don a jeweled crown of blazing snakes;

transliteration: drul dukpa barwa zawa
english: You who consume blazing poisonous serpents;

transliteration: zhin gyepa
english: You whose visage is expansive;

transliteration: minma dang tralwa düpa
english: You whose eyebrows and forehead are tensed;

transliteration: yasö ma chu nenpa
english: You whose upper teeth bite your lower lip;

transliteration: shinjé chajé chen
english: You whose accoutrements are those of Yāma;

transliteration: ché lok tar gyuwa
english: You whose tongue moves as fast as lightning;

transliteration: süpo ché drul zawa
english: You whose large belly digests snakes;

transliteration: lakpa dabpé dré jikpar jepa
english: You who terrify with the sound of clapping hands;

transliteration: lü gyalpo dab zang karak su chingpa
english: You, on whose belt, Garuḍa, the ruler of nāgas, is tied;

transliteration: a la la zhé drokpar jepa
english: You who proclaim, “A la la!”

transliteration: gyatsö zab su paktsé gyé tri yöpa kangpé pümor chinpa
english: You whose shins reach 80,000 leagues down to the depths of the ocean;

transliteration: wangpo dang nyima trakpa la kurwa
english: You who bear Indra and Sūrya upon your shoulders;

transliteration: lu tamché lakpar jepa
english: You who annihilate all nāgas;

transliteration: gegyang chenpo drokpé küntu trukpar jepa
english: You whose bellowing laughter makes everything tremble;

transliteration: shinjé zukchen
english: You who have the appearance of Yāma;

transliteration: kham sumpa jikpar jepa
english: You who frighten the three realms;

transliteration: lu nam chiwar jepa la chaktsal lo
english: You, the slayer of nāgas!

transliteration: sangye dang changchub sempa tamché la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas!

transliteration: diké dak gi töpa dü chik na
english: Thus have I heard.

transliteration: chomdendé nyen du yöpa na gyalbu gyal jé kyi tsal gönmé zé jin gyi kün ga rawa na
english: Once the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s garden in the Jetavana grove,

transliteration: gelong gi gendün chenpo gyatrak ché dang chusum dang
english: Together with a great gathering of twelve hundred and fifty monks,

transliteration: changchub sempa sempa chenpo mangpo dak dang tab chik tu zhuk té
english: And a great gathering of many bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

transliteration: dené chomdendé kyi gelong nam la katsal pa
english: At that time, the Blessed One said to the monks:

transliteration: gelong dak lhamo özer chen ma zhejawa zhik yö dé
english: “Monks, there is a goddess called Mārīcī.

transliteration: dé nyima dang dawé dün dang dün né dro té
english: She travels before the sun and moon.

tibetan: དེ་བལྟར་མེད། གཟུང་དུ་མེད། བཅིང་དུ་མེད། དགག་ཏུ་མེད། བརྒལ་དུ་མེད། རྨོངས་པར་བྱར་མེད། ཆད་པས་གཅད་དུ་མེད། མགོ་འབྲེག་ཏུ་མེད། བཞུར་མེད། ཚིག་པར་བྱར་མེད། དགྲའི་དབང་དུ་མི་འགྲོའོ། །
transliteration: dé tarmé zung du mé ching du mé gak tumé gal du mé mongpar jarmé chepé ché du mé go drek tumé zhurmé tsikpar jarmé dré wang du mi dro o
english: She is invisible, ungraspable, unstoppable, insuperable, indomitable, unsurpassable, unassailable, invulnerable, unconquerable, imperishable, and invincible.

tibetan: དགེ་སློང་དག །གང་གིས་ལྷ་མོ་འོད་ཟེར་ཅན་མ་དེའི་མིང་ཤེས་པ་དེ་ཡང་བལྟར་མེད། གཟུང་དུ་མེད། བཅིང་དུ་མེད། དགག་ཏུ་མེད། བརྒལ་དུ་མེད། རྨོངས་པར་བྱར་མེད། ཆད་པས་གཅད་དུ་མེད། མགོ་འབྲེག་ཏུ་མེད། བཞུར་མེད། ཚིག་པར་བྱར་མེད། དེ་དགྲའི་དབང་དུ་འགྲོ་བར་མི་འགྱུར་རོ། །
transliteration: gelong dak gang gi lhamo özer chen ma dé ming shepa deyang tarmé zung du mé ching du mé gak tumé gal du mé mongpar jarmé chepé ché du mé go drek tumé zhurmé tsikpar jarmé dé dré wang du drowar mingyur ro
english: Monks, whoever recalls the goddess Mārīcī’s name likewise will become invisible, ungraspable, unstoppable, insuperable, indomitable, unsurpassable, unassailable, invulnerable, unconquerable, imperishable, and invincible.

transliteration: detar dak gi kyang lhamo özer chen mé ming shé kyi dak kyang tar mepar gyur chik zung du mé par gyur chik ching du mé par gyur chik gak tu mepar gyur chik gal du mé par gyur chik mongpar jarmé par gyur chik chepé ché du mé par gyur chik go drek tu mepar gyur chik zhur mepar gyur chik tsikpar jarmé par gyur chik dré wang du mi drowar gyur chik
english: Thus, I myself, by recalling the goddess Mārīcī’s name, have become invisible, ungraspable, unstoppable, insuperable, indomitable, unsurpassable, unassailable, invulnerable, unconquerable, imperishable, and invincible.

transliteration: dé la sang ngak kyi tsik ni dinam yin no
english: The sacred mantra is as follows:

tibetan: ཏདྱ་ཐཱ། ཨོཾ་པ་ཏཱ་གྲ་མ་སི། པ་རཱ་ཀྲ་མ་སི། ཨུ་ད་ཡ་མ་སི། ནཻ་ར་མ་སི། ཨརྐྐ་མ་སི། མརྐྐ་མ་སི། ཨུ་ར་མ་མ་སི། བ་ན་མ་སི། གུ་ལ་མ་མ་སི། ཙཱི་བ་ར་མ་སི། མཧཱ་ཙཱི་བ་ར་མ་སི། ཨན་ཏར་དྷྭཾ་ནཱ་མ་སི་སྭཱཧཱ།
transliteration: teyata | om patakra masi paratra masi udaya masi naira masi arka masi marka masi urama masi vana masi gulma masi civara masi maha civara masi antar dhana masi soha ||
english: tadyathā | oṃ padākramasi parākramasi udayamasi nairamasi arkamasi markamasi uramamasi1 vanamasi gulmamasi cīvaramasi mahā-cīvaramasi antardhānamasi svāhā ||

transliteration: om lhamo özer chen dak lam du kyob shik | dak lam lokpa lé kyob shik | dak kyewö jikpa lé kyob shik | dak gyalpö jikpa lé kyob shik | dak langpö jikpa lé kyob shik | dak chomkün gyi jikpa lé kyob shik | dak lü jikpa lé kyob shik | dak sengé jikpa lé kyob shik | dak tak gi jikpa lé kyob shik | dak mé jikpa lé kyob shik | dak chü jikpa lé kyob shik | dak drul gyi jikpa lé kyob shik | dak duk gi jikpa lé kyob shik | dak chir golwa dang dra tamché lé kyob shik |
english: oṃ, goddess Mārīcī, please protect me on the road! Please protect me from taking wrong paths! Please protect me from dangerous beings! Please protect me from the danger of tyrants! Please protect me from the danger of elephants! Please protect me from the danger of thieves! Please protect me from the danger of nāgas! Please protect me from the danger of lions! Please protect me from the danger of tigers! Please protect me from the danger of fire! Please protect me from the danger of water! Please protect me from the danger of snakes! Please protect me from the danger of poison! Please protect me from the danger of opponents and adversaries!

tibetan: འཁྲུགས་པ་དང༌། མ་འཁྲུགས་པ་དང༌། ཉམས་པ་དང༌། མ་ཉམས་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་དུ་སེངྒེ་ལས་སྲུངས་ཤིག །བདག་སྟག་ལས་སྲུང་ཤིག །བདག་ཀླུ་ལས་སྲུངས་ཤིག །བདག་སྦྲུལ་ལས་སྲུངས་ཤིག །བདག་འཇིགས་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་དང༌། གནོད་པ་དང༌། ནད་འགོ་བ་དང༌། འཁྲུག་པ་ཐམས་ཅད་ལས་སྲུངས་ཤིག་སྲུངས་ཤིག །
transliteration: trukpa dang matrukpa dang nyampa dang manyampa tamché du sengé lé sung shik | dak tak lé sung shik | dak lu lé sung shik | dak drul lé sung shik | dak jikpa tamché dang nöpa dang né gowa dang trukpa tamché lé sung shik sung shik ||
english: In all instances, disturbed or undisturbed, weakened or not,2 please protect me from lions! Please protect me from tigers! Please protect me from nāgas! Please protect me from snakes! Svāhā! Please protect me from all dangers, harm, infectious disease and adversity! Protect! Protect!

transliteration: mi jé sadak gyalpö ngatang nyampa dok
english: Prevent the decline of the power of rulers, lords, and kings.

transliteration: geweshé nyen gyi densa tongpa dok
english: Prevent the clearance of the spiritual teacher’s residence.

transliteration: tsünpé dul trim zhikpa dok
english: Prevent monastic discipline from breaking down.

transliteration: menpé ché ka lokpa dok
english: Prevent doctors from making misdiagnoses.

transliteration: tsi kyi kor go dzolwa dok
english: Prevent mistaken astrological calculations.

transliteration: shen rab lha dral tongpa dok
english: Prevent the clearing of shrines dedicated to Shenrab.39

transliteration: nam rimpa gü teng né shel gyija khyung shokpa debpa dok
english: Prevent the crystal garuḍa of the ninth stage of heaven from flapping his wings.40

transliteration: sa rimpa gü ok né dur pak nakpo khünpa dok
english: Prevent the black charnel pig of the ninth subterranean layer from grunting.

transliteration: zang kyi langpo ra darwa dok
english: Prevent the copper bull from grinding his horns.

transliteration: pu né dra jungwa dok
english: Prevent enemies from attacking us from above.

transliteration: lobur nga né si langpa dok
english: Prevent the si demons of the past from suddenly appearing.

transliteration: dursa nyenpo kha jewa dok
english: Prevent the opening of fearsome charnel grounds.

transliteration: yé drok sumgya drukchu dok
english: Prevent the advent of the three hundred and sixty primordial bewitchers.41

transliteration: lobur gyechu tsa chik dok
english: Avert the eighty-one accidents.

transliteration: dön rik tongtrak sumgya dok
english: Avert the three hundred thousand types of evil spirits.

transliteration: mi chuk chi yi si ngen dok
english: Prevent the evil si demons from attacking humans and their livestock.

transliteration: drong tso drar lang si ngen dok
english: Prevent the evil si demons from turning our neighbors into enemies.

transliteration: chok chü dé truk langpa dok
english: Prevent war from ever arising in any direction.

transliteration: dü ngen ta si ngenpa dok
english: Avert the hostile gods and demons of this kaliyuga.

transliteration: milam tsenma ngenpa dok
english: Avert bad signs in dreams.

transliteration: jé ngen jor tsub jekha purkha dok
english: Avert black magic, sorcery, curses, and witchcraft.

transliteration: né chepa té tram ngen ngak dok
english: Avert broken oaths, evil diagrams and wicked spells.

transliteration: mitün chok nam malü zhi gyur chik
english: Thus pacify all adversities, without exception.

transliteration: sangyé dang changchub sempa tamché la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas!

transliteration: diké dak gi töpa dü chik na
english: Thus have I heard at one time.

transliteration: chomdendé dorjé la zhuk té
english: The Blessed One was abiding in Vajra.1

transliteration: sangye kyi tü lak na dorjé lü tamché dorjér jin gyi lab né
english: Through the power of the Buddha, Vajrapāṇi’s entire body was consecrated as vajra

transliteration: dorjé ting ngé dzin la nyompar zhuk so
english: And Vajrapāṇi entered the vajra-like samādhi.

transliteration: dené lak na dorjé sangye kyi tu dang
english: Then, through the power of the Buddha,

transliteration: sangye tamché kyi jin gyi lab dang
english: The blessing of all the buddhas,

transliteration: changchub sempa tamché kyi jin gyi lab kyi
english: And the blessing of all the bodhisattvas,

transliteration: dorjé trowo lé jungwa dorjé nyingpo rabtu mé té
english: Vajrapāṇi proclaimed the vajra-essence which arose from vajra-wrath:

tibetan: མི་ཆོད་པ། མི་ཤིགས་པ། བདེན་པ། སྲ་བ། བརྟན་པ། ཐམས་ཅད་དུ་ཐོགས་པ་མེད་པ། ཐམས་ཅད་དུ་མ་ཕམ་པ།
transliteration: mi chöpa mishik pa denpa sawa tenpa tamché du tokpa mepa tamché duma pampa
english: “It is unbreakable, indestructible, true, solid, stable, unobstructed by all, and invincible by all;2

transliteration: semchen tamché trakpar jepa
english: It terrifies all beings,

transliteration: semchen tamché jilwar jepa
english: It makes all beings flee,

transliteration: rik ngak tamché chöpar jepa
english: It severs all vidyā-mantras,3

transliteration: rik ngak tamché nönpar jepa
english: It suppresses all vidyā-mantras;

transliteration: lé tamché jompar jepa
english: It defeats all saṃsāric actions;

transliteration: zhen gyi lé tamché jikpar jepa
english: It neutralizes all that others do to you;

transliteration: dön tamché lakpar jepa
english: It crushes all obstructing forces;

transliteration: dön tamché lé tarwar jepa
english: It liberates from all obstructing forces;

transliteration: jungpo tamché gukpar jepa
english: It controls all spirits;4

transliteration: rik ngak kyi lé tamché jé du jukpa
english: It enacts the functions of all vidyā-mantras;

transliteration: madrubpa nam drubpar jepa
english: It accomplishes what has not been accomplished;

transliteration: drubpa nam chü mi zawar jepa
english: It preserves all that has been accomplished;

transliteration: döpa tamché rabtu jinpa
english: It grants all wishes;

transliteration: semchen tamché sungwa zhiwa gyepa
english: It protects, pacifies and enriches all beings;

transliteration: semchen tamché rengpar jepa
english: And it paralyses and stupefies all beings.”

english: Through the power of the Buddha, Vajrapāṇi then proclaimed this very powerful secret mantra:

transliteration: dikpa tamché jang jé né

transliteration: dukngal tamché mepar jé

transliteration: gyü do chok gi tsawa té
english: It is the root of all tantras,

transliteration: tsé zepa dang tsé nyam dang

transliteration: pün sum tsok min gang chak dang
english: All who are in inauspicious circumstances,

transliteration: lha nam gyab kyi chokpa dang
english: Forsaken by the gods,

transliteration: dza duk kyewo dangwa dang
english: People who face hostility from close ones,

transliteration: dren za lasok tsepa dang
english: Oppressed people, such as servants,

transliteration: pentsün tünpa mayin dang
english: Those who live in discord,

transliteration: nor dribpé ni nöpa dang
english: Who are harmed by loss of wealth,

transliteration: nya ngen ngal dang nöpa dang
english: Who are in despair or injured,

transliteration: jikpa dang ni pongpa dang
english: Frightened or destitute,

transliteration: za dang gyukar jetem dang
english: Afflicted by harmful planets, constellations or curses,

transliteration: mi zé dön gyi nyenpa dang
english: Who are harmed intolerably by spirits,

transliteration: nya ngen ngal lé jungwa yi
english: Who see evil omens in dreams

transliteration: milam dikpa tong na yang
english: Caused by weariness or sorrow—

transliteration: dé ni rab trü tsangma yin
english: All are completely cleansed by this mantra and thus become pure.

transliteration: dodé dampa nyenpar gyi
english: Listen, therefore, to this sacred sūtra!

transliteration: gangdak yi gesem dang zhing
english: All who have a virtuous and pure mind,

transliteration: tsangmé gö kyi rab gyen té
english: And are adorned with fine clothes–

transliteration: zabmo sangye chöyulwa
english: When they listen to this sutra,

transliteration: dodé di ni nyen jé na
english: The Buddha’s profound domain—

transliteration: dodé di yi ziji kyi
english: Will, through the splendour of this sūtra,

transliteration: sokchak dak ni tamché kyi
english: Be cured of

transliteration: dedak tamché zhiwar ta
english: Even the most intractable ones;

transliteration: tsé dang sönam pelwar gyur
english: Their lifespan and merit will increase,

transliteration: dikpa kün lé nampar tar
english: And they will be freed from all negativity!

transliteration: norbu yungkar duba dang
english: Take a vase made of gold, silver or the like,5

transliteration: rinchen mamé tsanden ché
english: And fill it with precious substances, jewels, mustard seeds, dūrvā-grass,

transliteration: tsangmé gö kyi tri zhing gang
english: Attach a clean cloth to it.

transliteration: len drang nyishu tsa chik gam
english: Recite the Vajravidāraṇa mantra

transliteration: yangna len drang gya tsa gyé
english: Twenty-one times, or

transliteration: dorjé namjom dé né ni
english: One hundred and eight,

transliteration: gyalpo taktu trü gyi shik
english: O King, and therewith always perform ablutions.

transliteration: nyammé mi yo nyamnyi chok gi chönyi chen
english: Incomparable, with the nature of sublime, unwavering equality,

transliteration: tukjé daknyi drowé dukngal selwar dzé
english: Embodiment of compassion, dispeller of beings’ every woe,

transliteration: yönten tayé ngödrub tamché jin dzepa
english: Boundless in enlightened qualities, the granter of all siddhis,

transliteration: drimé mi yo nyammé dampé chok chöchen
english: Immaculate, unmoving, supremely noble in character.

transliteration: yönten shintu trawé cha la ang tsemé dé
english: Even the merest fraction of your qualities is beyond measure,

transliteration: pé ni namkha dang yang dren du yö mayin
english: Just as the boundless sky itself is entirely beyond compare.

transliteration: ngödrub tayé nyammé pé dang dralwa nam
english: Infinite attainments, incomparable and unrivalled—

transliteration: semchen kham la ngödrub chok nam ngepar tsol
english: Supreme siddhis you confer assuredly on beings.

transliteration: taktu drima mepa tukjé shuk lé jung
english: Forever flawless, born of the force of compassion,

transliteration: mönlam drubpa gokpa mepé chönyi chen
english: The fulfilment of aspirations, by nature unstoppable,

transliteration: drowé dön drub rabtu tsönpa tayepa
english: You accomplish beings’ aims, and, with limitless endeavour,

transliteration: tukjé chenpö daknyi taktu nampar nang
english: Appear at all times as the epitome of great compassion.

transliteration: tsemé tsé dang dralwa shintu yongdzokpé
english: Beyond measure, unfathomable, entirely perfect and complete,

transliteration: dewar shekpé gopang dampa nyé gyur kyang
english: You attained the sublime level of a sugata, one gone to bliss,

transliteration: kham sum nam la ngödrub chok tsol dzepa yi
english: Yet still bestow supreme siddhis throughout the triple world—

transliteration: tukjé chöpa mi yo gakpar yong mingyur
english: Your compassionate activity steadfast and never-ending.

transliteration: emaho shintu zangpö chönyi chok dangden
english: Emaho! Your nature is so utterly perfect and supreme.

transliteration: chok jin nam kyi nang né gopang chok nyepa
english: You attained the most sublime state, the best of all gifts.

transliteration: kham sum kün la taktu ngödrub chok tsol dzé
english: And always grant the supreme siddhi on all three realms.

transliteration: gönpo dü sum dribpa mepa rab khyenpé
english: Protector, unrestricted in your knowledge of the three times,

transliteration: damtsik chok sum ngödrub dampa dak la tsol
english: Grant me the perfect siddhis of the three supreme samayas!

transliteration: di ni sangye tamché kyi
english: Speaking just once in this way

transliteration: yangdak yönten gyaché té
english: Of all the enlightened buddhas’

transliteration: len chik tsam zhik jöpé kyang
english: True qualities, in their vastness,

transliteration: sangye tamché drubpar gyur
english: Brings the accomplishment of all buddhas.

transliteration: könchok sum la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Three Jewels!

transliteration: om bhurkum maha pranaya bhurtsi bhurki manasé utsusma krodha hung hung pé pé soha

transliteration: chaktsal chaktsal chaktsal tö
english: Homage! Homage! Homage and praise!

transliteration: tro la tröpé trowo ché
english: Wrathful toward wrath, great wrathful deity,

transliteration: sangye sangye ngar sangye
english: Buddha—buddha who awakened before the Buddha,

transliteration: chöku longku trulpé ku
english: Dharmakāya, sambhogakāya, and nirmāṇakāya—

transliteration: metsek zheja dak chaktsal
english: To you, renowned as Bhurkuṃkūṭa, I offer homage!

transliteration: kalpé mé tar bar ü na
english: Seated upon a lotus, sun, and moon-disc throne,

transliteration: pema nyidé den la zhuk
english: Encircled by a blazing halo of apocalyptic fire,

transliteration: jang nak chenpo mewachen
english: You stand, dark green and pockmarked,

transliteration: zhal sumpa la chak druk té
english: With three faces and six mighty arms.

transliteration: yé kar yön mar ü jangwa
english: Your right face is white, your left is red,

transliteration: chen sum jikpé chewa jin
english: Your central face is green, all with three eyes—each baring terrifying fangs,

transliteration: mi tsang dütsi men zhin sol
english: Devouring impurity like the nectar of medicine.

transliteration: yepa dorjé raldri nam
english: In your right hands: a vajra and a sword.

transliteration: yönpa zhakpa chakkyu o
english: In your left: a lasso and an iron hook.

transliteration: tama dikdzub tukkar nol
english: The final pair of hands cross at your heart in the threatening gesture.

transliteration: mé tsang mepé lé dak tsön
english: You act tirelessly, beyond pure or impure.

transliteration: dukpa drul gyi u lü gyen
english: Your head and limbs adorned with venomous serpents,

transliteration: jik ngang mepar tulzhuk chö
english: You practice yogic austerity with fearless power.

transliteration: trogyal khyé la chaktsal lo
english: Wrathful King, to you I offer homage!

transliteration: mi tsangwa ni tsangwar dzé
english: You who transmute the impure into pure—

transliteration: trogyal khyö la chaktsal tö
english: Wrathful King, homage and praise to you!

transliteration: jikpa kün lé kyobpar dzé
english: You who protect us from all fears—

transliteration: trogyal khyö la chaktsal tö
english: Wrathful King, homage and praise to you!

transliteration: né dang rim lé sungwar dzé
english: You who guard against illness and plague—

transliteration: trogyal khyö la chaktsal tö
english: Wrathful King, homage and praise to you!

transliteration: mi tsang zé dang mi tsang gö
english: You who are supreme in purifying

transliteration: tamché selwar jepé chok
english: Tainted food and garments,

transliteration: lha dang lu dang nöjin dön
english: You who delight, without exception,

transliteration: tamché malü gawar dzé
english: Gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and spirits alike,

transliteration: né dang rim dang dal ka yam
english: You who protect against disease, illness, and plague—

transliteration: sungwé lé dzé chaktsal tö
english: To you I offer homage and praise.

transliteration: dak la sungwa dzé du sol
english: Please grant us your protection.

transliteration: mi tsangwa nam tsangwar dzé
english: You who make the impure pure,

transliteration: mewa nam ni mi mer dzé
english: The blemished unmarked,

transliteration: chiwa nam ni yangwar dzé
english: The heavy light,

transliteration: dokpa yangpar dzé la tö
english: The narrow wide—

transliteration: trowö gyalpo metsek khyé
english: I offer praise to you!

transliteration: sangye kün gyi jin gyi lab
english: Those devoted to you

transliteration: gangdak khyé la mö ten nam
english: Find ease in body, mind, and faculties.

transliteration: lü dé sem dé wangpo dé
english: Homage to you, deity of ease.

transliteration: dewé lha la chaktsal lo
english: They are purified in body, mind, and faculties.

transliteration: lü dak sem dak wangpo dak
english: Homage to you, deity of purity.

transliteration: dakpé lha la chaktsal lo
english: They are cleansed in body, mind, and faculties.

transliteration: lü tsang sem tsang wangpo tsang

english: At that time, the Blessed One entered an absorption on categories of phenomena called ‘perception of the profound’.

transliteration: yang dé tsé changchub sempa sempa chenpo pakpa chenrezik wangchuk sherab kyi parol tu chinpa zabmo chöpa nyi la nampar ta zhing
english: At the same time, noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva and great being, beheld the practice of the profound perfection of wisdom,

transliteration: pungpo ngapo dedak la yang rangzhin gyi tongpar nampar ta o
english: And saw that the five aggregates are empty of nature.

transliteration: dené sangye kyi tü
english: Then, through the Buddha's power,

transliteration: tsé dang denpa sharibü changchub sempa sempa chenpo pakpa chenrezik wangchuk la diké ché mé so
english: Venerable Śāriputra said to noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva and great being:

transliteration: rik kyi bu gang lala sherab kyi parol tu chinpa zabmo chöpa chepar döpa dé jitar labpar ja
english: “How should a child of noble family who wishes to practise the profound perfection of wisdom train?”

transliteration: deké ché mepa dang | changchub sempa sempa chenpo pakpa chenrezik wangchuk gi tsé dang denpa shara datibu la diké ché mé so
english: This is what he said, and the noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva and great being, replied to venerable Śāriputra as follows:

transliteration: sharibu rik kyi bu am rik kyi bumo gang lala sherab kyi parol tu chinpa zabmo chöpa chepar döpa dé ditar nampar tawar ja té
english: “O Śāriputra, a son of noble family or daughter of noble family who wishes to practise the profound perfection of wisdom should regard things in this way:

transliteration: pungpo ngapo dedak kyang rangzhin gyi tongpar nampar yangdakpar jesu ta o
english: They should see the five aggregates to be empty of nature.

transliteration: zuk tongpa o | tongpanyi kyang zuk so
english: Form is empty; emptiness is form;

transliteration: zuk lé tongpanyi zhen mayin no
english: Emptiness is not other than form;

transliteration: tongpanyi lé kyang zuk zhen mayin no
english: Form is not other than emptiness.

transliteration: dezhindu tsorwa dang | dushé dang
english: In the same way, sensation, recognition,

transliteration: dujé dang | nampar shepa nam tongpa o
english: Conditioning factors and consciousness are emptiness.

transliteration: sharibu detawé na chö tamché tongpanyi dé
english: Therefore, Śāriputra, all dharmas are emptiness.

transliteration: tsennyi mepa | makyepa | magakpa
english: They are without characteristics; they are unarisen and unceasing;

transliteration: drima mepa | drima dang dralwa mepa
english: They are not tainted and not untainted;

transliteration: driwa mepa | gangwa mepa o
english: They are not deficient and not complete.

transliteration: sharibu detawé na tongpanyi la zukmé
english: Therefore, Śāriputra, in emptiness, there is no form,

transliteration: tsorwa mé | dushé mé | dujé nam mé | nampar shepa mé
english: No sensation, no recognition, no conditioning factors, no consciousness;

tibetan: མིག་མེད། རྣ་བ་མེད། སྣ་མེད། ལྕེ་མེད། ལུས་མེད། ཡིད་མེད།
transliteration: mik mé | nawa mé | na mé | che mé | lü mé | yi mé
english: No eye, no ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind;

tibetan: གཟུགས་མེད། སྒྲ་མེད། དྲི་མེད། རོ་མེད། རེག་བྱ་མེད། ཆོས་མེད་དོ། །
transliteration: zuk mé | dra mé | dri mé | ro mé | rekja mé | chö mé do
english: No visible form, no sound, no odour, no taste, no texture, and no mental objects;

transliteration: mik gi kham mepa né yi kyi kham mé
english: There is no eye element up to no mind element;

transliteration: yi kyi nampar shepé kham kyi bardu yang mé do
english: And as far as no mental consciousness element;

transliteration: marikpa mé | marikpa zepa mepa né gashi mé
english: There is no ignorance, no extinction of ignorance up to no old age and death,

transliteration: gashi zepé bardu yang mé do
english: No extinction of old age and death;

transliteration: dukngalwa dang | künjungwa dang
english: No suffering, no origin,

transliteration: gokpa dang | lam mé | yeshe mé | tobpa mé
english: No cessation, no path, no wisdom, no attainment,

transliteration: matobpa yang mé do
english: And no non-attainment.

transliteration: sharibu detawé na changchub sempa nam tobpa mepé chir
english: Therefore, Śāriputra, since bodhisattvas have no attainment,

transliteration: sherab kyi parol tu chinpa la ten ching né té
english: They rely on and abide by the perfection of wisdom.

transliteration: sem la dribpa mepé trakpa mé dé
english: Since their minds are unobscured, they have no fear.

transliteration: chin chi lok lé shintu dé né nya ngen lé depé tarchin to
english: They completely transcend error and reach the ultimate nirvāṇa.

transliteration: dü sum du nampar zhukpé sangye tamché kyang sherab kyi parol tu chinpa la ten né
english: All the buddhas throughout the three times

transliteration: lana mepa yangdakpar dzokpé changchub tu ngönpar dzokpar sangye so
english: Fully awaken to unsurpassable, true, complete enlightenment by means of the perfection of wisdom.

transliteration: detawé na sherab kyi parol tu chinpé ngak
english: Therefore, the mantra of the perfection of wisdom—

transliteration: rigpa chenpö ngak | lana mepé ngak
english: The mantra of great insight, the unsurpassed mantra,

transliteration: minyampa dang nyampé ngak | dukngal tamché rabtu zhiwar jepé ngak
english: The mantra that equals the unequalled, the mantra that pacifies all suffering—

transliteration: midzünpé na denpar shepar ja té
english: Is not false and should be understood as true.

transliteration: sherab kyi parol tu chinpé ngak mepa
english: The mantra of the perfection of wisdom is proclaimed as follows:

transliteration: teyata | om gaté gaté para gaté | para samgaté | bodhi soha
english: tadyathā | oṃ gate gate pāragate | pārasaṃgate | bodhi svāhā

transliteration: sharibu changchub sempa sempa chenpö detar sherab kyi parol tu chinpa zabmo la labpar ja o
english: Śāriputra, a bodhisattva and great being should train in the profound perfection of wisdom in this way.”

transliteration: dené chomdendé ting ngé dzin dé lé zheng té
english: Thereupon, the Blessed One arose from that absorption

transliteration: changchub sempa sempa chenpo pakpa chenrezik wangchuk la lek so zhejawa jin né
english: And commended Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva and great being:

transliteration: lek so lek so | rik kyi bu de dezhin no | rik kyi bu de dezhin té
english: “Excellent, excellent, O son of noble family, that is how it is. That is just how it is.

transliteration: jitar khyö kyi tenpa dezhindu sherab kyi parol tu chinpa zabmo la chepar ja té
english: One should practise the profound perfection of wisdom just as you have taught

transliteration: dezhin shekpa nam kyang jesu yi rang ngo
english: And then even the tathāgatas will rejoice.”

transliteration: chomdendé kyi deké ché katsal né
english: When the Blessed One had said this,

transliteration: tsé dang denpa sharibu dang
english: Venerable Śāriputra, and

transliteration: changchub sempa sempa chenpo pakpa chenrezik wangchuk dang
english: Noble Avalokiteśvara, the bodhisattva and great being,

transliteration: tamché dang denpé khor dedak dang | lha dang | mi dang
english: Together with the whole assembly and the world of gods, human beings,

transliteration: lha mayin dang | drizar chepé jikten yi rang té
english: Asuras and gandharvas rejoiced and praised

transliteration: chomdendé kyi sungpa la ngönpar tö do
english: The speech of the Blessed One.

transliteration: chomden dema sherab kyi parol tu chinpé nyingpo zhejawa tekpa chenpö do dzok so
english: Thus concludes the Mahāyāna Sūtra of the Blessed Mother, the Heart of the Transcendent Perfection of Wisdom.

transliteration: namo, lama la chaktsal lo
english: Namo! Homage to the Guru!

transliteration: sangye la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Buddha!

transliteration: chö la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Dharma!

transliteration: gendün la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Saṅgha!

transliteration: yum chenmo sherab kyi parol tu chinpa la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Great Mother, Prajñāpāramitā!

transliteration: khyé nam la chaktsalwé tu dang nüpa la ten né
english: Through the power and strength of paying homage to you,

transliteration: dakchak gi tsik di drubpar gyur chik
english: May these words of ours come true!

transliteration: jitar ngön lhé wangpo gyajin gyi yum chenmo sherab kyi parol tu chinpé dön zabmo yi la sam zhing tsik khatön du jepé tu dang nüpa la ten né
english: Just as, long ago, the king of the gods Indra, by the power and strength of contemplating the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, the Great Mother, and reciting its words,

transliteration: dü dikchen lasokpa chir dokpa dezhindu dak gi kyang yum chenmo sherab kyi parol tu chinpé dön zabmo yi la sam zhing tsik khatön du jepé tu dang nüpa la ten né
english: Was able to avert the demonic forces of negativity, so in the very same way, may we too, through the power and strength of contemplating the profound meaning of the Perfection of Wisdom, the Great Mother, and reciting its words,

transliteration: dak khor dang chepé dampé chö drubpé pangja mitünpé chok tamché chir dokpar gyur chik
english: Avert all the negative influences which prevent us and those around us from accomplishing the Noble Dharma!

transliteration: mepar gyur chik
english: May they be annihilated!

transliteration: zhiwar gyur chik
english: May they be rendered harmless!

transliteration: rabtu zhiwar gyur chik
english: May they be completely pacified!

transliteration: gang gi ten ching drelwar jung
english: Everything that arises interdependently

transliteration: gakpa mepa kyé mepa
english: Is unceasing and unborn,

transliteration: chepa mepa tak mepa
english: Neither non-existent nor everlasting,

transliteration: ongwa mepa dro mepa
english: Neither coming nor going,

transliteration: tadé dön min dön chik min
english: Neither multiple nor single.

transliteration: tröpa nyerzhi zhi tönpa
english: To this teaching that pacifies all concepts and duality,

transliteration: dzokpé sangye ma nam kyi
english: The most sacred speech of the fully enlightened Buddha,

transliteration: dampa dé la chaktsal lo
english: We pay homage!

transliteration: dzokpé changchub drubpa la
english: May all obstacles,

transliteration: chi dang nang gi tsewa yi
english: Outer and inner,

transliteration: bardu chöpa tamché kün
english: To our attaining complete enlightenment,

transliteration: nyewar zhiwar dzé du sol
english: Be totally pacified!

transliteration: zhenyang kyewa dinyi du
english: Also, in this very life,

transliteration: mitün chok kün zhiwa dang
english: May everything inharmonious be pacified, and

transliteration: tsering nemé pünsum tsok
english: May we always enjoy peace and happiness, long life,

transliteration: taktu dé dangden gyur chik
english: Good health, prosperity and success!

transliteration: tamché khyenpa la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the omniscient one!

transliteration: ditar sangye chomdendé dezhin shekpa drachompa yangdakpar dzokpé sangye rigpa dang zhab su denpa
english: Thus the Buddha, the transcendent, accomplished conqueror, the tathāgata who has attained suchness, the arhat who has conquered all foes, is a perfectly and completely enlightened buddha, endowed with insight and worthy of reverence,

transliteration: dewar shekpa
english: The sugata who has reached the state of bliss,

transliteration: jikten khyenpa
english: The knower of the entire world,

transliteration: kyebu dulwé khalo gyurwa
english: The guide and tamer of beings,

transliteration: lanamepa
english: The unsurpassable one,

transliteration: lha dang mi nam kyi tönpa
english: The teacher of gods and humans,

transliteration: sangye chomdendé té
english: The Buddha Bhagavat.

transliteration: dezhin shekpa dé ni sönam dak gi gyu tünpa
english: The tathāgata is in harmony with all merit.

transliteration: gewé tsawa nam chü mi zawa
english: He does not waste the sources of virtue.

transliteration: zöpé rabtu gyenpa
english: He is fully adorned with patience.

transliteration: sönam kyi ter nam kyi zhi
english: He is the foundation of the treasures of merit.

transliteration: pejé zangpo nam kyi trepa
english: He is ornamented with the excellent minor marks.

transliteration: tsen nam kyi metok gyepa
english: He is the full blossoming of the major marks.

transliteration: chöyul renpar tünpa
english: His activity is timely and fitting.

transliteration: tong na mitünpa mepa
english: Seeing him, there is nothing displeasing.

transliteration: depé möpa nam la ngönpar gawa
english: He brings true joy to those who have faith.

transliteration: sherab zil gyi mi nönpa
english: His insight overwhelms all in its splendour.

transliteration: tob nam la dziwa mepa
english: His powers are invincible.

transliteration: semchen tamché kyi tönpa
english: He is the teacher of all sentient beings.

transliteration: changchub sempa nam kyi yab
english: He is the father of all bodhisattvas.

transliteration: pakpé gangzak nam kyi gyalpo
english: He is the sovereign of all the noble ones.

transliteration: nya ngen lé depé drongkhyer du drowa nam kyi depön
english: He is the guide who leads beings to the city of nirvāṇa.

transliteration: yeshe paktu mepa
english: He has measureless wisdom.

transliteration: pobpa sam gyi mi khyabpa
english: He possesses inconceivable fearlessness.

transliteration: sung nampar dakpa
english: His speech is utterly pure.

transliteration: yang nyenpa
english: Its tones are melodious.

transliteration: ku jé tawé chok mishepa
english: One can never have enough of looking at him.

transliteration: ku tsungpa mepa
english: His form is without comparison.

transliteration: döpa dak gi magöpa
english: He is unsullied by the realm of desire.

transliteration: zuk dak gi nyewar magöpa
english: He is quite unsullied by the realm of form.

transliteration: zuk mépa dak dang madrepa
english: He is not caught up in the formless realm.

transliteration: dukngal dak lé nampar drolwa
english: He is completely liberated from suffering.

transliteration: pungpo dak le rabtu nampar drolwa
english: He is totally liberated from the aggregates.

transliteration: kham nam dang mi denpa
english: He is not possessed with the constituents of ordinary experience.

transliteration: kyemché nam dampa
english: He is in control of the sense fields.

transliteration: düpa nam shintu chepa
english: He has cut right through the knots.

transliteration: yongsu dungwa dak lé nampar drolwa
english: He is completely liberated from torment.

transliteration: sepa lé drolwa
english: He is freed from craving.

transliteration: chuwo lé galwa
english: He has crossed over the river.

transliteration: yeshe yongsu dzokpa
english: He is perfected in all the wisdoms.

transliteration: depa dang majönpa dang dantar jungwé sangye chomdendé nam kyi yeshe la nepa
english: He abides in the wisdom of all the buddhas of past, present and future.

transliteration: nya ngen lé depa la mi nepa
english: He does not dwell in nirvana.

transliteration: yangdakpa nyi kyi ta la nepa
english: He abides in perfect finality.

transliteration: semchen tamché la zikpé sa la zhukpa té
english: He remains on the level where he sees all sentient beings.

transliteration: didak ni sangye chomdendé nam kyi ku chewé yönten yangdakpa nam so
english: All these are the authentic and supreme qualities of the embodiment of the Buddha.

transliteration: dampé chö ni tokmar gewa bardu gewa tamar gewa
english: The sacred Dharma is good at the beginning, good in the middle and good at the end.

transliteration: dön zangpo
english: It is excellent in meaning,

transliteration: tsikdru zangpo
english: Excellent in words and syllables.

transliteration: madrepa
english: It is distinctive.

transliteration: yongsu dzokpa
english: It is totally complete.

transliteration: yongsu dakpa
english: It is utterly pure.

transliteration: yongsu jangwa
english: It completely purifies.

transliteration: chomdendé kyi chö lekpar sungpa
english: The Buddha teaches the Dharma perfectly.

transliteration: yangdakpar tongwa
english: It brings unerring vision.

transliteration: né mepa
english: It is without affliction.

transliteration: dü chepa mepa
english: It is constant and always timely.

transliteration: nyewar töpa
english: It is trustworthy when applied.

transliteration: di tongwa la dön yöpa
english: Seeing it fulfils one’s purpose.

transliteration: khepa nam kyi soso rang gi rigpar jawa
english: The wise can validate it through their own awareness.

transliteration: chomdendé kyi sungpé chö dulwa la lekpar tenpa
english: The Dharma taught by the buddha relies entirely on training the mind.

transliteration: ngepar jungwa
english: It is truly delivering.

transliteration: dzokpé changchub tu drowar jepa
english: It causes one to arrive at perfect enlightenment.

transliteration: mitünpa mé ching düpa dang denpa
english: It is without contradiction. It is all-embracing.

transliteration: tenpa yöpa
english: It is constant.

transliteration: gyuwa chepa o
english: It is the cessation of all uncertainty.

transliteration: tekpa chenpö gendün ni lekpar zhukpa
english: As for the Sangha of the Great vehicle, they enter thoroughly.

transliteration: rikpar zhukpa
english: They enter with awareness.

transliteration: drangpor zhukpa
english: They enter straightforwardly.

transliteration: tünpar zhukpa
english: They enter harmoniously.

transliteration: talmo jarwé ö su gyurpa
english: They are worthy of veneration with palms joined together.

transliteration: chak jawé ö su gyurpa
english: They are worthy of receiving prostrations.

transliteration: sönam kyi pal gyi zhing
english: They are a glorious field of merit.

transliteration: yön yongsu jongwa chenpo
english: Offering to them brings great purification.

transliteration: jinpé né su gyurpa
english: They are an object of generosity.

transliteration: küntu yang jinpé né su gyurpa chenpo o
english: They are in every way the greatest object of generosity.

transliteration: yum chenmo sherab kyi parol tu chin ma la chaktsal lo
english: Homage to the Great Mother Prajñāpāramitā!

transliteration: diké dak gi töpa dü chik na
english: Thus have I heard:

transliteration: chomdendé gyalpö khabja gö pungpö ri la
english: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rājgṛha at Vulture Peak mountain,

transliteration: gelong gi gendün chenpo gyatrak ché dang chusum dang
english: Together with a great gathering of twelve hundred and fifty monks,

transliteration: changchub sempa jewa trak trik mangpo dang tab chik tu zhuk so
english: And a great gathering of myriad bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

transliteration: dé tsé chomdendé kyi tsé dang denpa küngawo la diké ché katsal to
english: At that time, the Blessed One said to venerable Ānanda:

transliteration: küngawo sherab kyi parol tu chinpa yigé chik ma zhejawa di semchen nam la penpa dang dewé chir zung shik
english: O Ānanda, since The Perfection of Wisdom ‘In One Syllable’ will bring benefit and happiness to sentient beings, please remember it!

transliteration: di ta té
english: It is like this:

transliteration: chomdendé kyi deké ché ka tsalpa dang
english: When the Blessed One had said this,

transliteration: tsé dang denpa küngawo dang gelong dedak dang changchub sempa sempa chenpo dedak tamché kyi parol tu chinpa jesu tok shing yirang né
english: Venerable Ānanda together with all the monks and bodhisattva mahāsattvas realized the perfection of wisdom.

transliteration: chomdendé kyi sungpa la ngönpar tö do
english: They rejoiced, and thus praised the speech of the Blessed One.

transliteration: jinyé su dak chok chü jikten na
english: To all the buddhas, the lions of the human race,

transliteration: dü sum shekpa mi yi sengé kün
english: In all directions of the universe, through past and present and future:

transliteration: dak gi malü dedak tamché la
english: To every single one of you, I bow in homage;

transliteration: lü dang ngak yi dangwé chak gyi o
english: Devotion fills my body, speech and mind.

transliteration: zangpo chöpé mönlam tob dak gi
english: Through the power of this prayer, aspiring to Good Action,

transliteration: gyalwa tamché yi kyi ngönsum du
english: All the victorious ones appear, vivid here before my mind

transliteration: zhing gi dul nyé lü rab tüpa yi
english: And I multiply my body as many times as atoms in the universe,

transliteration: gyalwa kün la rabtu chaktsal lo
english: Each one bowing in prostration to all the buddhas.

transliteration: dul chik teng na dul nyé sangye nam
english: In every atom preside as many buddhas as there are atoms,

transliteration: sangye sé kyi ü na zhukpa dak
english: And around them, all their bodhisattva heirs:

transliteration: detar chö kyi ying nam malüpa
english: And so I imagine them filling

transliteration: tamché gyalwa dak gi gangwar mö
english: Completely the entire space of reality.

transliteration: dedak ngakpa mizé gyatso nam
english: Saluting them with an endless ocean of praise,

transliteration: yang kyi yenlak gyatsö dra kün gyi
english: With the sounds of an ocean of different melodies

transliteration: gyalwa kün gyi yönten rab jö ching
english: I sing of the buddhas’ noble qualities,

transliteration: dewar shekpa tamché dak gi tö
english: And praise all those who have gone to perfect bliss.

transliteration: metok dampa trengwa dampa dang
english: To every buddha, I make offerings:

transliteration: silnyen nam dang jukpa duk chok dang
english: Of the loveliest flowers, of beautiful garlands,

transliteration: marmé chok dang dukpö dampa yi
english: Of music and perfumed ointments, the best of parasols,

transliteration: gyalwa dedak la ni chöpar gyi
english: The brightest lamps and finest incense.

transliteration: naza dampa nam dang dri chok dang
english: To every buddha, I make offerings:

transliteration: chema purma rirab nyampa dang
english: Exquisite garments and the most fragrant scents,

transliteration: köpa khyepar pakpé chok kün gyi
english: Powdered incense, heaped as high as Mount Meru,

transliteration: gyalwa dedak la ni chöpar gyi
english: Arranged in perfect symmetry.

transliteration: chöpa gang nam lamé gya chewa
english: Then the vast and unsurpassable offerings—

transliteration: dedak gyalwa tamché la yang mö
english: Inspired by my devotion to all the buddhas, and

transliteration: zangpo chö la depé tob dak gi
english: Moved by the power of my faith in Good Actions—

transliteration: gyalwa kün la chaktsal chöpar gyi
english: I prostrate and offer to all you victorious ones.

transliteration: döchak zhedang timuk wang gi ni
english: Whatever negative acts I have committed,

transliteration: lü dang ngak dang dezhin yi kyi kyang
english: While driven by desire, hatred and ignorance,

transliteration: dikpa dak gi gyipa chi chipa
english: With my body, my speech and also with my mind,

transliteration: dedak tamché dak gi sosor shak
english: Before you, I confess and purify each and every one.

transliteration: chok chü gyalwa kün dang sangye sé
english: With a heart full of delight, I rejoice at all the merits

transliteration: ranggyal nam dang lob dang mi lob dang
english: Of buddhas and bodhisattvas,

transliteration: drowa kün gyi sönam gangla yang
english: Pratyekabuddhas, those in training and the arhats beyond training,

transliteration: dedak kün gyi jesu dak yi rang
english: And every living being, throughout the entire universe.

transliteration: gang nam chok chü jikten drönma nam
english: You who are like beacons of light shining through the worlds,

transliteration: changchub rimpar sangye machak nyé
english: Who passed through the stages of enlightenment, to attain buddhahood, freedom from all attachment,

transliteration: gönpo dedak dak gi tamché la
english: I exhort you: all of you protectors,

transliteration: lü kyi ta ni tokpa po

transliteration: zuk nam natsok küntu tön

transliteration: sangye kün gyi tok jawa

transliteration: sang ngak dön kün kyepa po

transliteration: chudruk ché ché tiklé chen

transliteration: yenlak mepé tsi lé dé

transliteration: samten yenlak kün shé shing

transliteration: jikten chok chur rabdrak pa

transliteration: chö kyi jindak chewa po

transliteration: jampé gocha chepa té

transliteration: nyingjé yi ni ya lé gö

transliteration: sherab raldri dazhu tok

transliteration: nyönmong mi shé yulngo sel

transliteration: pawo dü dra düdul ba

transliteration: dü zhi jikpa selwar jé

transliteration: dü kyi pung nam pam jepa

transliteration: dzokpé sangye jikten dren

transliteration: chö ö tö ö chak gi né

transliteration: taktu rimdro jawé ö

transliteration: kur ö jewar jawé ö

transliteration: chak jar öpa lamé rab

transliteration: jikten sumpo gom chik drö

transliteration: kha tar tamé nampar nön
english: His step extending past the bounds of space,

transliteration: sum rik tsangma dakpa té

transliteration: ngönshé drukden jedren druk

transliteration: changchub sempa sempa ché

transliteration: dzutrul chenpo jikten dé

transliteration: sherab parol chinpé ta

transliteration: sherab kyi ni denyi tob

transliteration: dak rik zhen rik tamché pa

transliteration: jikten sum na kalzang ché

transliteration: palden jorpa kün jepa

transliteration: chok jin dorjé chok khyö dü

transliteration: tongnyi lé jung khyö la dü

transliteration: sangye changchub khyö la dü

transliteration: sangye dö la chaktsal dü

transliteration: sangye gyepa khyö la dü

transliteration: sangye sung nyi khyö la dü

transliteration: namkha lé jung khyö la dü

transliteration: dikpa tamché sosor shak
english: All my misdeeds, each and every one, I confess.

transliteration: drowé gé la jé yi rang

transliteration: sangye changchub yi kyi zung

transliteration: sangye chö dang tsok chok la

transliteration: changchub bardu kyab su chi

transliteration: rangzhen dön ni rab drub chir
english: In order to accomplish my own and others' aims,

transliteration: changchub sem ni kyepar gyi
