transliteration: changchub chok gi sem ni kyé gyi né
english: Having set my mind upon supreme awakening,

transliteration: semchen tamché dak gi drön du nyer
english: I invite all sentient beings to be my guests.

transliteration: changchub chö chok yi ong chepar gyi
english: I shall carry out the supreme, delightful actions of a bodhisattva.

transliteration: dro la pen chir sangye drubpar shok
english: May I attain enlightenment in order to benefit all beings.

transliteration: tukjé chenpo chomden dorjé sem
english: Great compassionate one, the conqueror Vajrasattva,

transliteration: drimé dung dok chok tu zuk zangwa
english: Supreme in appearance, the colour of a pristine conch,

transliteration: namdak ösal da ö kyil na dzé
english: Pure and luminous, resplendent in your moonlight halo,

transliteration: pawo özer tong bar lammewa
english: A brave warrior illuminated by a thousand brilliant rays.

transliteration: sipa sum gyi sa khen tönpar drak
english: Renowned as a guide to those in the three planes of existence,

transliteration: kham sum drowa kün gyi nyen chikpo
english: Sole companion to all beings throughout the triple realm,

transliteration: jam gön tukjé lha khyö gong su sol
english: Kind protector, compassionate deity, heed me now, I pray.

transliteration: dak ni tokma mepé dü ta né
english: Throughout the whole of beginningless time,

transliteration: lam lok lam tor sipé khorwar khyam
english: I have taken wrong paths, lost my way, and wandered in saṃsāra.

transliteration: ngöntsé lé lok dikpa jepé nong
english: Through past misdeeds and harmful actions, I have gone astray.

transliteration: dikpé lé nam chi ché rang nong gyö
english: Whatever negative acts I have committed, I now remorsefully admit.

transliteration: dar zhing drakpé lé wang dé tsenpé
english: Through the powerful force of terrible, intensifying karma,

transliteration: khorwé dukngal gyatsor jing gyur té
english: I am immersed in the great ocean of suffering within saṃsāra:

transliteration: zhedang barwé mé ni ranggyü sek
english: The raging infernos of aggression set my mind ablaze,

transliteration: timuk münpa tibpé sherab dong
english: The thick darkness of ignorance blinds my intellect,

transliteration: döchak gyatsö dam du namshé jing
english: The muddy swamp of desire draws in my sinking consciousness,

transliteration: ngagyal drekpé riwö ngendror nen
english: The mountain of arrogant pride pushes me down to evil destinies,

transliteration: trakdok lungmar tsubpé khorwar yeng
english: And the tempestuous winds of jealousy sweep me into saṃsāra.

transliteration: dak tu tawé düpa dampö ching
english: I am bound by the tight knots of the view of self,

transliteration: döpa medak dong dré ob su lhung
english: Flung into the pit of passion’s burning embers,

transliteration: dukngal drakpo mi zé char tar bab
english: And intense, unbearable suffering pours down upon me like rain.

transliteration: dindré dukngal shintu zö ka zhing
english: Such miserable torment is extremely difficult to endure,

transliteration: dikpé lé wang drakpo mebarwé
english: And the raging fires of powerfully negative actions

transliteration: namshé wangpö nyugu dung gyur té
english: Have caused the shoots of my consciousness to wither.

transliteration: pungpo gyumé lü kyi mi zö na
english: It is too much for this body of illusory aggregates to bear.

transliteration: jam gön tukjé chen gyi zö lak sam
english: Can you, my kind and compassionate protector, acquiesce?

transliteration: dak dra lün mong lé ngen dikpo ché
english: I, so foolish and deluded, a doer of terrible, wicked deeds,

transliteration: lé kyi wang gi dökham rudrar kyé
english: Have, through force of karma, been born as rudra in this desire realm.

transliteration: kyepé gyö do lé la yi ré ché
english: How I regret such a rebirth! How my past actions depress me!

transliteration: yiché gyö kyang lé la chö su mé
english: Yet for all my despondency and remorse, there can be no remedy.

transliteration: lé kyi shuk ni chuwö gyün dang dra
english: The force of my karma is like the flow of a river in spate—

transliteration: lé wang chulung tral du gala dok
english: How could this stream of karma be suddenly reversed?

transliteration: nammin tamché rang gi lé lé jung
english: All these karmic effects have come about through my own actions.

transliteration: ka la zhuk kyang ka zhin ngo ma tok
english: I received instructions, but could not do as I was told.

transliteration: lü ngak yi sum dikpé wang du song
english: With body, speech, and mind, I slipped into negativity.

transliteration: lé kyi lungmar drakpo dé depé
english: Swept along by the fierce winds of karma,

transliteration: dak ni dengön kalpa drangmé du
english: Through countless ages in the past,

transliteration: khorwé tsönra münpar khyampa la
english: I wandered through the dark dungeons of saṃsāra.

transliteration: nyené khyé kyi tukjé jinlab kyi
english: Now through your compassionate blessings,

transliteration: lé dang nyönmong dribpa né jang né
english: Karmic and emotional obscurations are purified at their source,

transliteration: ma tar jampé zhab drung dantar khö
english: And I find myself before you who are a font of motherly love,

transliteration: nyi tar öbar da tar dang salwé
english: You who are as dazzling as the sun, as radiant as the moon.

transliteration: tukjé zhal nyi tawé mi ngompa
english: With your face of compassion at which I never tire of looking.

transliteration: tokma mé né marik ling tok gi
english: I have been blind throughout beginningless time,

transliteration: dongpé chubur mik gi ma tong na
english: Unable to see you through the cataracts of ignorance.

transliteration: drowé gön khyö dengön gang na zhuk
english: Protector of beings, where were you in the past?

transliteration: lé wang drakpo rabtu mizepé
english: So utterly unbearable is karma’s intense force,

transliteration: shintu trak ching kyi ya rab jik né
english: That I shiver in terror and tremble in fright,

transliteration: dung dung dungwé mengak di dön ching
english: And cry out in this longing, sorrowful lament.

transliteration: nyamtak pongpé ngarö dön lak na
english: As I call to you in my weariness and distress,

transliteration: jam gön tukjé dü dir ma gong na
english: If you do not consider me, O kind, compassionate protector,

transliteration: namzhik chipo lü sem dralwé tsé
english: Then, when death comes and it’s time for body and mind to part,

transliteration: geshé drok dangdral né shinjé tri
english: I will leave my teacher and friends as Yama leads me away.

transliteration: detsé jikten nyé dü mi tong té
english: Then, in a world bereft of friends and dear relations,

transliteration: lé kyi wang gi daknyi chikpur tri
english: I will be led on alone, carried by the force of karma.

transliteration: dü der dak la gön kyab ma chi na
english: At that time, if I should lack refuge or protection,

transliteration: gang gi chishol dü lé mazhepar
english: Please do not hesitate for any reason,

transliteration: danta nyi du tün té ngönchö dzö
english: But act directly and forcefully, right away.

transliteration: lé kyi narwé kyewo dak drawa
english: Those who are tormented by karma, as I am,

transliteration: tokma mepé dü né lok takpé
english: Have misunderstood throughout beginningless time,

transliteration: kham sum khorwé né lé ma tar té
english: Failed to escape the abodes of saṃsāra’s three realms,

transliteration: kalpa drangmé kyewa jinyé du
english: And in the course of many lives throughout unnumbered ages,

transliteration: dö ché lü lang drangmé zhik gyur té
english: Have taken on countless bodily forms, all of which decayed.

transliteration: sha rü sak na jikten tö dang nyam
english: Our flesh and bones, if amassed, would span the universe.

transliteration: naktrak sak na gyatso chenpo tsam
english: Our pus and blood, if collected, would be equal to the oceans.

transliteration: letro sak na sam dé jö mi lang
english: Our actions, if enumerated, would defy thought and utterance.

transliteration: kham sum drang shing kyeshi kha gyü kyang
english: In the course of these rounds of birth and death in the three realms

transliteration: jepé lé nam dönmé chü ré zö
english: All that we have done has been to no avail.

transliteration: kyewa drangmé jinyé detsam gyi
english: In all these countless rebirths

transliteration: kyewa tsé chik khona tsam gyi lé
english: If the acts of just a single lifetime

transliteration: lamé changchub döndu rab ché na
english: Had been dedicated to unsurpassed awakening

transliteration: detsam jepé lé ladön rab yö
english: That alone would have been supremely purposeful.

transliteration: dön gyi yongyé nya ngen dé zin na
english: Surely I would thus have reached nirvāṇa.

transliteration: lé kyi wang tsen nyönmong tob chewé
english: Yet through karma’s force and the great strength of the afflictions,

transliteration: sha trak düpé lü lang khorwar khyam
english: I took on forms of flesh and blood to wander in saṃsāra,

transliteration: dukngal zö ka sipé tsönrar tsü
english: Imprisoned in existence where distress is hard to bear.

transliteration: mi zé drakpö dukngal di tabu
english: Such miseries as these, unbearable in intensity—

transliteration: nyejé tamché rang gi lé lé jung
english: Every form of harm has arisen from my own deeds.

transliteration: tukjé chenpö lé ngen gyün ché dé
english: In your great compassion, put an end to my wicked ways,

transliteration: nyönmong lé kyi lung di dok tu sol
english: And repel the winds of karma and affliction, I pray.

transliteration: marik lokpé lé dé wang tsenpé
english: When, through the force of ignorant, mistaken acts,

transliteration: mi shé münpé nang du ten khyam na
english: I must wander forever in the darkness of unknowing,

transliteration: yeshe drönmé zer gyi mi tong sam
english: Will you not assist me with the light of wisdom’s torch?

transliteration: nyejé lé kyi nammin mi zö na
english: When the ripening of past misdeeds is intolerable,

transliteration: tukjé chenpö trinlé mi dzé dam
english: Will you not take action out of great compassion?

transliteration: chin chi lok gi yangsar lhung lak na
english: When I have fallen into the abyss of errant ways,

transliteration: tukjé nyur gyok chak gi mi dzin nam
english: Will you not catch me with the swift hand of mercy?

transliteration: duk sum zö ké né kyi dung lak na
english: When I am stricken with the unendurable malady of the three poisons,

transliteration: tabkhé tukjé men gyi mi so’am
english: Will you not heal me with the medicine of compassionate skill-in-means?

transliteration: lé kyi nammin dukngal mebar na
english: When the fires of karmic ripening and suffering rage,

transliteration: tukjé silwé char gyün mi beb sam
english: Will you not bring the cooling rains of mercy?

transliteration: dukngal khorwé dam du jing gyur na
english: When I sink into the muddy swamp of saṃsāric suffering,

transliteration: tabkhé tukjé chakkyü mi dren nam
english: Will you not pull me out with the hook of compassionate skill-in-means?

transliteration: kham sum khorwé né su jang jang né
english: When, having repeatedly trained myself in the states of saṃsāra’s three realms,

transliteration: namzhik rang gi drebu tobpé tsé
english: I eventually attain the fruition for myself,

transliteration: pakpé tukjé chi tsal dön ma chi
english: Of what use will the Noble One’s compassion be?

transliteration: daknyi letrö wang tsen zhak na ta
english: Were you to leave me to the force of karmic throes,

transliteration: tukjé chezhé su la chizhik gyi
english: How could I then refer to you as generous of heart?

transliteration: pawo khyö la tukjé tob nga zhing
english: Heroic One, you possess the strength of compassion,

transliteration: ngön jung drelwé lé kyi tro tsen na
english: So when the karma of past connections overwhelms me,

transliteration: yalyol tangnyom lelo ma dzepar
english: Do not remain inattentive, unconcerned or passive,

transliteration: nying né da zik tukjé gyalwé lha
english: But heed my heart’s plea, right now, O sovereign deity of compassion!

transliteration: om jetsünma pakma drolma la chaktsal lo
english: Oṃ. Homage to the noble lady Tārā!

transliteration: chaktsal taré nyurma pamo
english: Homage to Tārā, swift and valiant,

transliteration: tuttara yi jikpa selma
english: Homage to Tuttārā, who banishes fear,

transliteration: turé dön kün jinpé drolma
english: Homage to Turā, who fulfils every need,

transliteration: sa hé yigé khyö la dü do
english: With svāhā we offer you honor and praise!1

transliteration: chaktsal drolma nyurma pamo
english: Homage to Tārā, swift and valiant,

transliteration: chen ni kechik lok dang dra ma
english: Whose glance flashes like flares of lightning;

transliteration: jikten sum gön chukyé zhal gyi
english: Born on the heart of a blossoming lotus

transliteration: gesar jewa lé ni jung ma
english: That rose from the tears of the Triple World’s Lord. (1)

transliteration: chaktsal tönké dawa küntu
english: Homage to the one whose countenance is

transliteration: gangwa gya ni tsekpé zhal ma
english: A hundred full moons gathered in autumn,

transliteration: karma tongtrak tsokpa nam kyi
english: Smiling and glowing with brilliant radiance,

transliteration: rabtu chewé ö rab bar ma
english: Like a thousand stars clustered, ablaze. (2)

transliteration: chaktsal ser ngo chu né kyé kyi
english: Homage, golden lady, whose lotus-hand

transliteration: pemé chak ni nampar gyen ma
english: Is graced with a blue water-born flower.

transliteration: jinpa tsöndrü katub zhiwa
english: You embody generosity, diligence, endurance,

transliteration: zöpa samten chöyul nyi ma
english: Serenity, patience and meditation. (3)

transliteration: chaktsal dezhin shekpé tsuktor
english: Homage to the one whose victories are endless,

transliteration: tayé nampar gyalwa chö ma
english: Jewel on the great Tathāgata’s crown.

transliteration: malü parol chinpa tobpé
english: You are well served by the heirs of the Victors,

transliteration: gyalwé sé kyi shintu ten ma
english: Those who’ve accomplished all the perfections. (4)

transliteration: chaktsal tuttara hung yigé
english: Homage to the one who, with tuttāra and hūṃ,

transliteration: dö dang chok dang namkha gang ma
english: Fills desire realms unto the ends of space.

transliteration: jikten dünpo zhab kyi nen té
english: You trample underfoot the seven worlds,

transliteration: lüpa mepar gukpar nü ma
english: And have the strength to summon all. (5)

transliteration: chaktsal gyajin melha tsangpa
english: Homage to the one, praised by Indra,

transliteration: lunglha natsok wangchuk chö ma
english: Agni, Brahmā, Maruts,2 and Śiva.

transliteration: jungpo rolang driza nam dang
english: All the hosts of bhūtas, vetālas,

transliteration: nöjin tsok kyi dün né tö ma
english: Gandharvas and yakṣas pay tribute to you. (6)

transliteration: chaktsal tré cheja dang pé kyi
english: Homage to the one who, with traṭ and phaṭ,

transliteration: parol trulkhor rabtu jom ma
english: Crushes the enemies’ yantras3 to dust.

transliteration: yé kum yön kyang zhab kyi nen té
english: With right leg bent in and left leg extended,

transliteration: mebar trukpa shintu bar ma
english: Shining you tread amidst a turbulent blaze. (7)

transliteration: chaktsal turé jikpa chenpö
english: Homage to Ture, the fearsome lady,

transliteration: dü kyi pawo nampar jom ma
english: Destroyer of the most powerful demons.

transliteration: chukyé zhal ni tronyer den dzé
english: With a lotus-face and a deep-furrowed brow,

transliteration: drawo tamché malü sö ma
english: You are the slayer of each and every foe. (8)

transliteration: chaktsal könchok sum tsön chakgyé
english: Homage to the one whose fingers grace

transliteration: sormö tukkar nampar gyen ma
english: Her heart and display the Three Jewels mudrā.

transliteration: malü chok kyi khorlö gyenpé
english: You’re graced by wheels adorning every direction,

transliteration: rang gi ö kyi tsok nam truk ma
english: With dazzling radiance that overwhelms all.4 (9)

transliteration: chaktsal rabtu gawa jipé
english: Homage to the one, supremely joyous,

transliteration: ugyen ö kyi trengwa pelma
english: Whose splendorous crown spreads garlands of light.

transliteration: zhepa rab zhé tuttara yi
english: Smiling and laughing, with tuttāre

transliteration: dü dang jikten wang du dzé ma
english: You bring demons and worlds under control. (10)

transliteration: chaktsal sa zhi kyongwé tsok nam
english: Homage to the one who can summon

transliteration: tamché gukpar nüpa nyi ma
english: The hosts of earthly guardians.

transliteration: tronyer yowé yigé hung gi
english: Your frown it quivers, and the syllable hūṃ

transliteration: pongpa tamché nampar drolma
english: Delivers us all from every misfortune. (11)

transliteration: chaktsal dawé dumbü ugyen
english: Homage to the one, so brightly adorned,

transliteration: gyenpa tamché shintu bar ma
english: Who has a sliver of moon for a crown,5

transliteration: ralpé trö na öpakmé lé
english: Your locks are graced by Amitābha,

transliteration: takpar shintu ö rab dzé ma
english: Whose gleaming rays stream forever forth. (12)

transliteration: chaktsal kalpa tamé mé tar
english: Homage to the one in a blazing halo

transliteration: barwé trengwé ü na né ma
english: Of flames, all-consuming, apocalyptic—

transliteration: yé kyang yön kum künné kor gé
english: Your right leg stretched out and left leg bent inward,

transliteration: dra yi pung ni nampar jom ma
english: The whirl of enemies blissfully crushing. (13)

transliteration: chaktsal sa zhi ngö la chak gi
english: Homage to the one who strikes the ground

transliteration: til gyi nün ching zhab kyi dung ma
english: With her palms and stamps her feet—

transliteration: tronyer chen dzé yigé hung gi
english: Your brow deeply furrowed, with hūṃ you smash

transliteration: rimpa dünpo nam ni gem ma
english: The seven netherworlds to nothing but dust. (14)

transliteration: chaktsal dé ma gé ma zhi ma
english: Homage to the one, blissful, gracious and tranquil,

transliteration: nya ngen dé zhi chöyul nyi ma
english: Whose domain is the peace of nirvāṇa.

transliteration: soha om dang yangdak denpé
english: With oṃ and svāhā in perfect union,

transliteration: dikpa chenpo jompa nyi ma
english: You destroy every terrible evil. (15)

transliteration: chaktsal künné kor rabga bé
english: Homage to the one, immersed in rapture,

transliteration: dra yi lü ni rabtu gem ma
english: Who shatters the bodies of all foes.

transliteration: yigé chupé ngak ni köpé
english: You manifest from the wisdom-syllable hūṃ,6

transliteration: rigpa hung lé drölma nyi ma
english: And display each of your mantra’s ten syllables. (16)

transliteration: chaktsal turé zhab ni dabpé
english: Homage to Ture, her feet stomping boldly,

transliteration: hung gi nampé sabön nyi ma
english: Formed from the seed of the syllable hūṃ.

transliteration: rirab mendara dang bikjé
english: The mountains of Meru, Mandara and Vindhya,

transliteration: jikten sum nam yowa nyi ma
english: And all the three worlds, you cause them to quake. (17)

transliteration: chaktsal lha yi tso yi nampé
english: Homage to the one, who holds in her hand

transliteration: ridak takchen chak na nam ma
english: A deer-marked moon7 like a divine lake.

transliteration: tara nyi jö pé kyi yigé
english: With tāra twice and then with phaṭ,

transliteration: duk nam malüpar ni selma
english: You totally cleanse all of the poisons. (18)

transliteration: chaktsal lha yi tsok nam gyalpo
english: Homage to the one, who is honored by kings

transliteration: lha dang mi'amchi yi ten ma
english: Of hosts divine, gods and kiṃnaras;8

transliteration: künné gocha gawa ji kyi
english: Clad in your armour of joy and splendour,

transliteration: tsö dang milam ngenpa selma
english: You clear away nightmares, soothe away strife. (19)

transliteration: chaktsal nyima dawa gyepé
english: Homage to the one whose eyes shine with lustre,

transliteration: chen nyipo la ö rabsal ma
english: Bright with the fullness of the sun and moon;

transliteration: hara nyi jö tuttara yi
english: With twice-uttered hara and then with tuttāre

transliteration: shintu drakpö rimné selma
english: You pacify even the cruelest of diseases. (20)

transliteration: chaktsal denyi sum nam köpé
english: Homage to the one with the power to free,

transliteration: zhiwé tu dang yangdak den ma
english: Who puts forth the realities as a set of three.

transliteration: dön dang rolang nöjin tsok nam
english: Supreme Ture, you completely destroy

transliteration: jompa turé rab chok nyi ma
english: The hordes of grahas,9 vetālas,10 and yakṣas.11 (21)

transliteration: tsawé ngak kyi töpa di dang
english: This Praise with the twenty-one verses of homage

transliteration: chaktsalwa ni nyishu tsa chik
english: Is itself the root mantra.

transliteration: lhamo la gü yangdak denpé
english: The wise who recite these words in earnest,

transliteration: loden gang gi rab dang jö dé
english: Filled with genuine devotion for this goddess, (22)

transliteration: sö dang torang langpar jé né
english: At dusk, and also having risen at dawn,

transliteration: drenpé mi jik tamché rab ter
english: With recollection, will be granted fearlessness;

transliteration: dikpa tamché rabtu zhijé
english: They will utterly eliminate all misdeeds,

transliteration: ngendro tamché jompa nyi do
english: And surmount all evil destinies. (23)

transliteration: gyalwa jewa trak dün nam kyi
english: Seventy million victorious buddhas

transliteration: nyurdu wang ni kurwar gyur la
english: Will swiftly confer empowerment upon them,

transliteration: di lé chewa nyi ni tob ching
english: And they will attain greatness in this world,

transliteration: sangye gopang tartuk der dro
english: And reach the ultimate state of buddhahood. (24)

transliteration: dé yi duk ni drakpo chenpo
english: Even the most powerful and toxic poisons,

transliteration: ten nepa am zhenyang drowa
english: Which derive from plants or living beings,

transliteration: zöpa dang ni tungpa nyi kyang
english: Whether eaten or taken as a draught,

transliteration: drenpé rabtu selwa nyi tob
english: Will be purged entirely by recalling this praise. (25)

transliteration: dön dang rim dang duk gi zirwé
english: Reciting this two or three or seven times12

transliteration: dukngal tsok ni nampar pang té
english: Will eliminate multitudes of suffering

transliteration: semchen zhenpa nam la yang ngo
english: Brought about by spirits, pestilence, and poison—

transliteration: nyi sum dün du ngönpar jö na
english: And this applies even to other beings as well. (26)

transliteration: bu döpé ni bu tob gyur zhing
english: Those who wish for progeny will have them;

transliteration: nor döpé ni nor nam nyi tob
english: Those who wish for riches will acquire them;

transliteration: döpa tamché tobpar gyur la
english: Each and every wish will hereby be fulfilled,

transliteration: gek nam mé ching sosor jom gyur
english: And obstacles, entirely vanquished, will be no more. (27)

transliteration: om, naljor wangpo yeshe tarchinpa
english: Oṃ. Lord of yoga who has attained the ultimate wisdom,

transliteration: dro la pen dzé tukjé wang gyur zhing
english: You who benefit beings and have mastered compassion,

transliteration: sipa sum gyi nyen gyur chikpu pa
english: Unique friend and ally to all three realms of existence,

transliteration: lha yi lha khyö dak la gong su sol
english: God among gods, pray turn your attention towards me.

transliteration: dewar shekpé trulpa gyatso dang
english: Oceanic emanations of the bliss-gone buddhas,

transliteration: naljor wangchuk drubpé tsokchen po
english: Vast assemblies of accomplished lords of yoga,

transliteration: lha dang lhamin ngakchang damtsik chen
english: And oath-bound mantra-holders, devas and the rest—

transliteration: künné düpa nam kyang gong su sol
english: Gathered from all around, pray turn your attention towards me.

transliteration: dak ni gyalsi tori longchö dang
english: For my part, I do not seek dominion, higher realms,

transliteration: döpé yönten dak drub ma lak té
english: Possessions and resources or the pleasures of the senses,

transliteration: dro la nying tsé khoné dön tsönpa
english: But strive only out of a loving and altruistic concern—

transliteration: di la künkhyen khyö ni pang du sol
english: Omniscient ones, witness this pledge of mine, I pray.

transliteration: gönpo yeshe dribpa mi ngawé
english: Protectors, since your wisdom is unobstructed,

transliteration: dak gi lhakpé sampa khyé kyi khyen
english: You understand this noble intention of mine.

transliteration: pakchok chen ngar jitar damchepa
english: Following my pledge in your sublime presence,

transliteration: sünpar mi gyi gön khyö lu ma lak
english: I shall not disappoint or deceive you, O protectors.

transliteration: nying né dak ni khé dang drak lasok
english: Sincerely I renounce all preoccupation with gain and fame,

transliteration: yo dang zangzing sem ni ten pang né
english: All forms of deception and concern for material possessions,

transliteration: zhendön drubpa chikpü sem zhak té
english: And by focusing my attention entirely on others’ benefit,

transliteration: naljor chöpa chenpo dak gi chö
english: I shall carry out the magnificent activities of a yogi.

transliteration: kuntuzangpo lanamepa yi
english: I set my mind on the supreme, unsurpassed

transliteration: changchub chok tu dak gi semkyé dé
english: Awakening of Samantabhadra,

transliteration: döndam dang ni kündzob changchub sem
english: And vow that henceforth I shall fully adopt

transliteration: deng né tsulzhin yongsu zungwar gyi
english: Ultimate and relative bodhicitta in the proper way.

transliteration: sokchak tamché galté dü gyur né
english: Even if all living creatures were to turn demonic

transliteration: dumbur tong du dak gi lü tub kyang
english: And cut my body into a thousand tiny pieces,

transliteration: changchub sem chok sherab nyingjé dang
english: Still I would not renounce supreme bodhicitta,

transliteration: yidam gyalwa khyé ni yong mi pong
english: Wisdom and compassion, or you, yidam deities.

transliteration: dorjé damtsik chenpo nam dang ni
english: Even at the cost of my life, I shall never forsake the great vajra samayas,

transliteration: dorjé lobpön dorjé checham dang
english: The vajra master, or my vajra brothers and sisters,

transliteration: zhenyang tekpa chok la zhukpa nam
english: As well as all who have entered the supreme vehicle,

transliteration: sok gi chir yang mi tong chi nü sung
english: And I shall always do whatever I can to protect them.

transliteration: khorwa dakmé gyumé rangzhin la
english: Saṃsāra, which is by nature unreal and illusory,

transliteration: dak ni jikpa chiyang ma chi té
english: Will not inspire the slightest fear in me at all,

transliteration: marik kyewo nam kyi dön ledu
english: As I joyfully remain until the very end of time

transliteration: chitar tuk gi bardu nepar tro
english: For the sake of those who live in ignorance.

transliteration: zhendön khorwa nam su chöpa na
english: While coursing through saṃsāric realms for others’ sake,

transliteration: changchub chöpa lab chen dak gi ché
english: I shall carry out great waves of enlightening activity.

transliteration: dro druk semchen nam la pen dak chir
english: In order to benefit sentient beings of the six classes

transliteration: rangwang du ni kyewa langwar gyi
english: I shall take on births according to my own intention.

transliteration: dak ni yongsu zungwé jikten nam
english: I shall not take delight in and cling to this world

transliteration: nya ngen dé la trowa ma chi té
english: Or pursue the limited transcendence of misery,

transliteration: gang dang gangdu dukngal né nam su
english: But continue to bring benefit for oceanic aeons

transliteration: kalpa gyatsor né shing penpar gyi
english: In states of suffering, wherever they may be.

transliteration: sipar yün ring dü su tsönpa ni
english: Prolonged exertion in conditioned existence

transliteration: changchub sempé yidam lakpé na
english: Is a bodhisattva’s commitment, and therefore

transliteration: jisi ngensong tongpar magyurpa
english: For as long as it takes to empty the lower realms,

transliteration: desi dak gi kyowé sem mi kyé
english: I shall continue without ever feeling discouraged.

transliteration: sherab tab kyi drowé dön gyipa
english: Working for beings’ sake with wisdom and method,

transliteration: nyingjé longchö dé lé machipé
english: And never lacking the provisions of compassion,

transliteration: sem nyal yidak shinjé jikten yang
english: I shall view even the hell realms, the land of pretas,

transliteration: lha yi gatsal tabur tawar gyi
english: And the world of Yama as heavenly gardens of delight.

transliteration: dro la tuk tsé pal gyi gul né sung
english: Inspired by loving kindness for beings, yogis produce

transliteration: naljor damchö dütsi chok nam ni
english: The sublime nectar of Dharma from their splendid throats.2

transliteration: dak gi jikten tukpa machipar
english: May I too dispense and propagate teachings as appropriate

transliteration: jitar tsampa zhindu gyepar gyi
english: Continuously until the very end of this world.

transliteration: sipa lé dang kyen gyi wang gyur té
english: Under the influence of worldly karma and conditions,

transliteration: gang dang gangdu damchö jikpa der
english: The sacred Dharma will cease to exist in certain places;

transliteration: mé tsok pudri so yang gal né ni
english: So even if I must traverse fire or a razors’s edge,

transliteration: chitar tuk gi bardu damchö zung
english: May I uphold the noble teachings until the end of time.

transliteration: lamé changchub chok tu semkyé dé
english: Setting my mind on supreme, unsurpassable awakening,

transliteration: drubpa chok la zhukpé kyewo la
english: And engaging in the supreme form of practice,

transliteration: tserab nam su tutsal chichi kyi
english: With whatever strength I can muster throughout my lives,

transliteration: kyé chen nam kyi gongpa taktu kang
english: May I always fulfil the enlightened intentions of great beings.

transliteration: dampé chö dang drubpé gek gyurpa
english: Whatever obstructs the sacred Dharma and its practice,

transliteration: mi dang mi min dukpa gangyang rung
english: Whether from human intervention or non-human forces,

transliteration: dak gi zhi dang trowö trinlé kyi
english: May I, through my peaceful and wrathful activity,

transliteration: yongsu zhi zhing nampar zhompar gyi
english: Pacify it all and put an end to it entirely.

transliteration: naljor chok gi tekchen lamé dang
english: Through the unsurpassable great vehicle of supreme yoga,

transliteration: dorjé gyalpo khyö la ten né ni
english: And through relying on you, the vajra sovereign,

transliteration: sangye zhing jang dro la men ledu
english: May I purify buddha realms and come to beings’ aid

transliteration: changchub nyingpo dak gi tokpar gyi
english: By realizing the essence of awakening.

transliteration: dak ni pakchok chakgya ngön trul té
english: If I should succumb to an untimely death,

transliteration: galté kabmé chiwé dü jung tsé
english: Then, by emanating a sublime and exalted mudrā form,

transliteration: sang ngak gönpo yeshe kyilkhor chen
english: May I arrive in your presence in order to continue the path,

transliteration: khyé kyi zhab kyi drung du chiwar gyi
english: O Guardian of secret mantra with your wisdom maṇḍala.3

transliteration: si sum dukngal chindra khyé kyi khyen
english: You know what suffering there is throughout the three realms.

transliteration: nyal tsok mepung zhiwar gyi lasok
english: So as I seek to act swiftly on behalf of beings,

transliteration: semchen dön la nyurdu dak chi na
english: By extinguishing the fires of the hells and so on,

transliteration: dampa nam kyi nütu tsal du sol
english: May the sublime ones grant me the power I require.

transliteration: hung, yeshe ku chok rangzhin kyilkhor ni
english: Hūṃ. The natural maṇḍala of the supreme wisdom kāya

transliteration: da gyé zhindu tröpa mi nga yang
english: Has no elaborate complexity, just like the full moon,

transliteration: tukjé nyi sal ö zhin nyom dzepa
english: Yet its compassion radiates as evenly as sunlight.

transliteration: dir shek dak la gong shing zhuk su sol
english: Approach now, I pray: consider me, and remain!

transliteration: jömé sherab miyo chö kyi ku
english: Inexpressible wisdom, which is the immovable dharmakāya;

transliteration: dechen longchö dzok ku rik ngé tso
english: Lords of the five families, the sambhogakāya of great bliss;

transliteration: tukjé tabkhé gyacher rolpé lha
english: And deities who display vast compassion and skilful means,

transliteration: zhitro trulpé ku la chaktsal lo
english: Nirmāṇakāya, peaceful and wrathful: to you I pay homage!

transliteration: ngö su jor dang yi kyi nam trulpé
english: Actual offerings and those created in the imagination,

transliteration: kuntuzangpo lamé chötrin gyi
english: As Samantabhadra’s unsurpassable, cloud-like bestowal,

transliteration: khaying namdak gyacher yong kö dé
english: Arranged extensively throughout space’s pure expanse—

transliteration: chi nang sangwé chöpa gyatsö chö
english: With an ocean of outer, inner and secret gifts, I offer!

transliteration: kuntuzangmo sangwé bhaga la
english: Through an experience of single taste, beyond union and separation,

transliteration: gyalwé kyilkhor rabjam malü kün
english: Wherein all the infinite maṇḍalas of the victorious buddhas

transliteration: dudral mepé ngang du ro chikpé
english: Are present in the secret bhaga of Samantabhadrī —

transliteration: nyimé changchub sem kyi nyé gyur chik
english: May non-dual bodhicitta delight you!

transliteration: sem kyi rangzhin chönyi namkha ché
english: The nature of mind is the great space of dharmatā;

transliteration: chö nam namdak yené ösal zhing
english: Phenomena, utterly pure, have always been clear light;

transliteration: naljor nyi ying ma sam lé depé
english: And the realm of this yoga is beyond speech and thought—

transliteration: nyamnyi changchub sem la taktu dü
english: To this bodhicitta of equality, I offer perpetual homage!

transliteration: kunzang dzogchen yené dalwa la
english: Within the ever-excellent, originally expansive great perfection

transliteration: chi nang sangwé köpé kyilkhor ni
english: Is the maṇḍala arrayed with outer, inner and secret aspects;

transliteration: nangsi namdak lha dang lhamö ying
english: Pure apparent existence is the sphere of male and female deities;

transliteration: jung dang jung gyur yabyum lhün dzok nam
english: And elements and elemental, spontaneously perfect buddha pairs.

transliteration: sang chen rab gyé zung chen daknyimé
english: The great consort revels in the magnificent secret;

transliteration: khaying long yang pemor khyilwa la
english: And in the sovereign lady’s lotus, the vast expanse of space,

transliteration: nyimé tiklé chenpor ösal zhing
english: Within the great non-dual bindu, there is clear light

transliteration: machö trömé changchub nyingpö ku
english: And bodhi-essence kāya, uncontrived and unelaborate.

transliteration: chiryang nangwa dechen yungdrung lha
english: All that appears is the everlasting deity of great bliss.

transliteration: dudral mepa sangwé kyilkhor ni
english: In the secret maṇḍala that is beyond union and separation

transliteration: daknyi chenpo rik nga yabyum dang
english: Are sovereigns, male and female buddhas of the five families,

transliteration: changchub chamdral trowo tromö tsok
english: Bodhisattvas and hosts of wrathful ones, male and female.

transliteration: dorjé lhamo tsok jé tsok kyi dak
english: Lord over hosts of vajra goddesses, master of the assembly,

transliteration: rik nga palchen trogyal yabyum chu
english: Glorious ones of the five families, ten wrathful kings and consorts,

transliteration: né dang yul gyi chakgya goma zhi
english: Female guardians of sacred lands and places, four female gatekeepers,

transliteration: yeshe trulpé lhatsok mangpo nam
english: The many hosts of deities who are wisdom emanations,

transliteration: ma tar jam shing sing tar dung lasok
english: Those who are caring like mothers and supportive as sisters,

transliteration: leknyé tangdzin damtsik jé chöpé
english: Who determine good and bad and evaluate samaya,

transliteration: chi nang khandro naljorma yi tsok
english: Hosts of outer and inner ḍākinīs and yoginīs,

transliteration: pang gyur dorjé damchen gong su sol
english: Witnesses and holders of vajra commitments, consider me!

transliteration: hung, tukjé dungtsob naljor dakchak gi
english: Hūṃ. We vidyādharas, successors of the compassionate,

transliteration: drowé döndu changchub semkyé dé
english: Generate bodhicitta for the sake of all living beings.

transliteration: lamé gopang dröpar jawé chir
english: And, in order to progress to the unsurpassable state,

transliteration: tenpa gyatso sosö dul trim dang
english: Uphold various disciplines from the oceanic teachings:

transliteration: ku sung tuk dang nyamjor dompé chok
english: The supreme pledge to unite with enlightened body, speech and mind,

transliteration: dorjé da ka damtsik ten gyi nyer
english: The vajra samaya, terrible to transgress, ever to be maintained,

transliteration: chi dang khyepar lhakpé damtsik nam
english: Both the general and special, higher commitments

transliteration: ngachir nö shing nyer du mé so tsal
english: We have received time and again and sworn to uphold.

transliteration: yündu mitong dawar migyi ching
english: We do not intentionally neglect or transgress our vows,

transliteration: dön lé gol zhing dok sem machi kyang
english: Waver in our purpose or turn away from it entirely,

transliteration: döja long yö nyampé lelo yi
english: Yet through the laziness of postponing actions,

transliteration: long du magyur tsalshuk chungwa dang
english: We fail to gain mastery and have very little fortitude,

transliteration: shezhin miden bakmé wanggyur té
english: We lack vigilance and stray into carelessness.

transliteration: gom la mitsön nyendrub yel lasok
english: We make no effort in meditation, neglect approach and accomplishment, and more.

transliteration: tsor dang matsor marik wang gi na
english: Knowingly and unknowingly, through our own ignorance,

transliteration: tönpé ka dang dam lé gal gyur té
english: We transgress the teacher’s commands and contravene commitments.

transliteration: naljor gangzhik damtsik nyampa dang
english: “A yogi must never associate, even for an instant,

transliteration: kechik tsam yang trepar mija zhé
english: With one who has transgressed the samaya.”

transliteration: ka lé jung zhing detar machok té
english: Such is the command, yet we fail to observe it.

transliteration: sang go cholwé yesal kawa dang
english: Confused as to the secret mantra’s entrance, discernment proves difficult;

transliteration: ngönshé mepé kyönchen matok té
english: Without higher perception, we do not recognize those at fault.

transliteration: nyam dang tsok dré nyampa kangwa dang
english: We mix with transgressors in the assembly and restore their transgressions;

transliteration: nyam dang nömin nam la chö shé dang
english: We teach Dharma to transgressors and unsuitable recipients;

transliteration: nyam la midzem nyampé kyön lasok
english: We do not avoid transgressors, but incur the fault of transgression and more;

transliteration: nyam dang drok shing nyampa dedak gi
english: Thus we have kept company with transgressors

transliteration: nyamdrib kyön gyi göpar gyur to tsal
english: And been sullied by their corrupting, transgressive influence.

transliteration: tsé di kyen dang yün gyi drib gyur nam
english: Such failings, which affect this life and cause long-term obscuration,

transliteration: rab nong gyöpé sem kyi tol lo shak
english: We now confess with a mind of intense remorse and regret.

transliteration: jampé tukjé dak la gong né kyang
english: Consider us with loving kindness and compassion,

transliteration: nyimé ying lé mingyur dak kö dé
english: And secure us steadfastly in the non-dual realm.

transliteration: mimik tangnyom ngang du zhuk né kyang
english: As you abide in non-referential equanimity,

transliteration: nyimé dön gyi tsangpa tsal du sol
english: Grant us the ultimate, non-dual absolution!

transliteration: döndam mikmé trö lé depa la
english: In the ultimate, beyond reference and elaboration,

transliteration: namtok gangyang mikpar mingyur ching
english: There is no conceptualising thought whatsoever;

transliteration: kündzob gyuma tsam gyi wang gi na
english: Yet should we err through the relative, mere illusion,

transliteration: nongpa chi na rab nong zöpar sol
english: This we intensely regret: forgive us, we pray!

transliteration: dü sum dé shek gyalwa khor dang ché
english: Victorious sugatas of past, present and future, together with your retinues,

transliteration: dorjé damchen ma lü gong su sol
english: And all you protectors bound by your vajra oath, turn your attention towards us!

transliteration: dang por changchub chok tu sem kyé dé
english: First we arouse bodhicitta and set our minds upon supreme awakening.

transliteration: drubpé rigdzin changchub go pang du
english: Then, to reach the enlightened stage of an accomplished vidyādhara,

transliteration: ku sung tuk kyi dorjé drubpé chir
english: And achieve the vajra body, speech and mind,

transliteration: yidam lha dang dorjé lobpön dang
english: We bring to mind each category of samaya commitment

transliteration: sangwé damtsik drang su nöpa la
english: To the yidam deity and the vajra master, together with all the secret commitments,

transliteration: damcha ka lé dawar mi gyi té
english: And make a pledge never to transgress the commands,

transliteration: lé dang kalwé nyalwar kyéwar gyur
english: Or else be born in hell according to our karmic fortune.

transliteration: dö chak zhé dang timuk nga gyal dang
english: Straying into desire, anger, dull indifference, pride,

transliteration: trak dok la sok shor né nong gyipa
english: Jealousy and so on, we have committed mistakes:

transliteration: dorjé lobpön tönpa dronmé la
english: To the torch-like teacher, the vajra master,

transliteration: nying né mé ching damtsik nyampa dang
english: We have been deeply disrespectful, and impaired our samayas,

transliteration: damtsik chikpé dorjé pün nam la
english: Towards our vajra brothers and sisters who share the same commitments,

transliteration: ngen sem lokpar tawa la sokpa
english: We have held cruel intentions, mistaken views and so on—

transliteration: ku yi damtsik nyampa tol lo shak
english: All these impairments in the samayas of enlightened body, we now confess!

transliteration: yidam lha yi chak gya ma sal zhing
english: We have not visualized clearly the ‘mudrā’ of the yidam deity,

transliteration: ngak kyi nyenpa drang lé chépa dang
english: We have interrupted the recitation of the approach mantra,

transliteration: dü druk lé kyi chöpa khyépar du
english: And failed to practise at the six times, but, in particular,

transliteration: nyen drup kongwé choga ma gyi té
english: We have not performed the fulfilment rituals of approach and accomplishment,

transliteration: ka tar ma chok zhung zhin ngo ma tok
english: And are incapable of following commands or written instructions—

transliteration: sung gi damtsik nyampa tol lo shak
english: All these impairments in the samayas of enlightened speech, we now confess!

transliteration: dorjé lobpön jampé kadrin gyi
english: Through the loving kindness of the vajra master,

transliteration: nyen khung gyü né sem kyi kyil du zhak
english: His words have poured through our ears into the centre of our hearts,

transliteration: tuk kyi mengak jinpé damtsik dré
english: But we pollute the samaya by revealing the wisdom‑mind instructions,

transliteration: sang tsam dé né cholwar mé la sok
english: And crossing the bounds of secrecy with our mindless chatter and so forth—

transliteration: tuk kyi damtsik nyampa tol lo shak
english: All these impairments in the samayas of enlightened mind, we now confess!

transliteration: chö nam nyampa nyi du ma tok té
english: We have failed to realize the equality of all phenomena—

transliteration: yenlak damtsik nyampa tol lo shak
english: Impairments of the branch samayas, we now confess!

transliteration: lé lo nyom lé nyi kyi wang gyur té
english: We have been overcome by laziness, indifference and lethargy—

transliteration: nyen drup damtsik nyampa tol lo shak
english: Impairments of the samayas of approach and accomplishment, we now confess!

transliteration: lü ngak yi kyi sung ja dépa yi
english: We have failed to keep the commitments with body, speech and mind—

transliteration: ku sung tuk kyi damtsik nyampa shak
english: Impairments of the samayas of enlightened body, speech and mind, we now confess!

transliteration: jetsün lama nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the enlightened presence of our venerable teachers,

transliteration: yo ché jor tsok chungwa tol lo shak
english: Our material offerings have been meagre and insubstantial—this we now confess!

transliteration: yidam lha tsok nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the enlightened presence of the yidam deities,

transliteration: ngön tok pong len chépa tol lo shak
english: We have held preferences, favouring some while rejecting others—this we now confess!

transliteration: khandro dé zhi nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the enlightened presence of the four classes of ḍākinī,

transliteration: khé lang dam ché nyampa tol lo shak
english: We have impaired our pledges and commitments—this we now confess!

transliteration: chö kyong sungma nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the enlightened presence of the dharma protectors and guardians,

transliteration: torma lo dar gyangpa tol lo shak
english: We have allowed months and years to pass without offering tormas—this we now confess!

transliteration: dü sum pa ma nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the presence of our mothers and fathers from past, present and future,

transliteration: drin len len gyi ma jal tol lo shak
english: We have not repaid them for their kindness—this we now confess!

transliteration: ché dang cham dral nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the presence of our vajra brothers and sisters and consorts,

transliteration: damtsik tsé dung chungwa tol lo shak
english: We confess that our commitment and affection have been weak!

transliteration: dro druk semchen nam kyi chen lam du
english: In the presence of the beings of the six realms,

transliteration: nying jé pen sem chung wa tol lo shak
english: We confess that our compassion and altruism have been weak!

transliteration: so sor tarpa nam kyi dompa dang
english: Any impairments and breakages in the vows of individual liberation,

transliteration: changchub sempa nam kyi labpa dang
english: The discipline of the bodhisattvas,

transliteration: rigpa dzinpa ngak kyi damtsik sok
english: Mantra commitments of the vidyādharas and so on,

transliteration: nyampa tamché tol shak mi chab bo
english: All these we now confess without hiding or concealing anything.

transliteration: mi bé len ché chö ching dompar gyi
english: From now on we will refrain from all such acts, and vow never to repeat them again.

transliteration: dü sum chépé dik drip tol shak na
english: As we confess all our harmful acts and obscurations of the past, present and future,

transliteration: tsangpar dzé né ku sung tuk la sok
english: Let them all be completely purified, and so grant us, we pray,

transliteration: chok dang tün mong ngö drup tsal du sol
english: Attainments, ordinary and supreme, of body, speech and mind!

transliteration: nubchok dewachen na öpakmé
english: Buddha of Boundless Light, residing in Sukhāvatī to the West;

transliteration: dru dzin po na pakchok jikten wang
english: Noble and Supreme World Lord, residing on Mount Potalaka;

transliteration: sindu gyatsor tsokyé dorjé pal
english: Glorious Lake-Born Vajra, residing in the Sindu ocean;

transliteration: orgyen yul du gyalpo tor chokchen
english: Turbaned King1 residing in the land of Uḍḍiyāna—I offer you this prayer.

transliteration: solwa deb so tulku pema jung
english: Nirmāṇakāya Padmākara, please grant your blessings!

transliteration: jingyi lob shik chimé rigdzin jé
english: Immortal vidyādhara, look upon me with compassion!

transliteration: tukjé zik shik gangchen lha chikpu
english: Sole deity of the Snowy Land, please grant your blessings,

transliteration: di chi samdön drubpar jingyi lob
english: So that all my wishes for this and future lives may be fulfilled!

transliteration: jordrol chöpé shanta rakshita
english: Preserver of Peace, you engage in union and liberation;

transliteration: lhasin dren khol dorjé drakpo tsal
english: Mighty Wrathful Vajra, you enslave gods and demons;

transliteration: zhitro künzik shakya sengé zhab
english: Lion of the Śākyas, all-seeing buddha both fierce and peaceful,

transliteration: sheja künkhyen loden choksé pal
english: Wise Seeker of the Sublime, knower of all there is to be known—

transliteration: solwa deb so tulku pema jung
english: Nirmāṇakāya Padmākara, please grant your blessings!

transliteration: jingyi lob shik chimé rigdzin jé
english: Immortal vidyādhara, look upon me with compassion!

transliteration: tukjé zik shik gangchen lha chikpu
english: Sole deity of the Snowy Land, please grant your blessings,

transliteration: di chi samdön drubpar jingyi lob
english: So that all my wishes for this and future lives may be fulfilled!

transliteration: chimé ku nyé tsewang rigdzin tsal
english: Deathless Vidyādhara, you attained the eternal body;

transliteration: zahor yul du padma sambhava
english: Padmasambhava, you journeyed to Zahor;

transliteration: mepung tso ru gyurwé padma gyal
english: Lotus King,2 you turned the fire into a lake;

transliteration: mutek dul dzé sengé dra drokpa
english: Lion’s Roar, you tamed all heretics—I offer you this prayer.

transliteration: solwa deb so tulku pema jung
english: Nirmāṇakāya Padmākara, please grant your blessings!

transliteration: jingyi lob shik chimé rigdzin jé
english: Immortal vidyādhara, look upon me with compassion!

transliteration: tukjé zik shik gangchen lha chikpu
english: Sole deity of the Snowy Land, please grant your blessings,

transliteration: di chi samdön drubpar jin gyi lob
english: So that all my wishes for this and future lives may be fulfilled!

transliteration: ngödrub chok nyé dorjé tötreng tsal
english: Mighty Vajra with Skull-Garland, you achieved the supreme siddhi;

transliteration: trisong zhepa yong kong pema jung
english: Lotus-Born,3 you fulfilled King Tri Songdetsen’s every wish;

transliteration: dü dang damsi dul dzé drowolö
english: Wild Wrathful Vajra,4 you tamed all demons and obstructors;

transliteration: zangdok palrir ga karma drakpo tsal
english: Mighty Wrathful Karma, residing on the Copper-Coloured Mountain—I offer you this prayer.

transliteration: solwa deb so tulku pema jung
english: Nirmāṇakāya Padmākara, please grant your blessings!

transliteration: jingyi lob shik chimé rigdzin jé
english: Immortal vidyādhara, look upon me with compassion!

transliteration: tukjé zik shik gangchen lha chikpu
english: Sole deity of the Snowy Land, please grant your blessings,

transliteration: di chi samdön drubpar jingyi lob
english: So that all my wishes for this and future lives may be fulfilled!

transliteration: gön khyö drowa kün gyi kyab gyur kyang
english: Protector, you are the refuge for all beings;

transliteration: böyul tenpa nyi ö tabur sal
english: Like the sun, you illuminate Tibet with the teachings;

transliteration: ri drak tso sok né kün jingyi lob
english: You suffused with your blessings Tibet’s caves, lakes and lands;

transliteration: zabter drangmé gyé tab kadrinchen
english: In your kindness you concealed profound treasures beyond number—I offer you this prayer.

transliteration: solwa deb so tulku pema jung
english: Nirmāṇakāya Padmākara, please grant your blessings!

transliteration: jingyi lob shik chimé rigdzin jé
english: Immortal vidyādhara, look upon me with compassion!

transliteration: tukjé zik shik gangchen lha chikpu
english: Sole deity of the Snowy Land, please grant your blessings,

transliteration: di chi samdön drubpar jingyi lob
english: So that all my wishes for this and future lives may be fulfilled!

transliteration: trinlé zhung sang chötö soldeb pa
english: During all activities—practices, offerings, prayers and praises,

transliteration: miché güpé tukdam gyü kul na
english: If your wisdom-being is invoked with unshakable devotion,

transliteration: dü kyi gyalpo tsé chu nam shar la
english: Then at sunrise on the excellent tenth day you will come!

transliteration: jönpar zhal gyi zhepé dorjé sung
english: This is your vajra-speech and your promise!

transliteration: lumé denpé drebu yolmé du
english: In your excellence, don’t delay—bestow now upon me

transliteration: lekpar tsol chik orgyen trulpé ku
english: The result, the unfailing truth, Nirmāṇakāya of Uḍḍiyāna.

transliteration: rewa kong zhik sampel wang gi gyal
english: This is my prayer—fulfil my hopes and grant my wishes.

transliteration: soltab drebu tsol zhik pema jung
english: Padmākara, please grant me the fruits!

transliteration: nying né dungshuk drakpö depa dang
english: My heart is filled with longing, and yearning devotion,

transliteration: ngak né lhang lhang yang kyi soldeb na
english: And my speech is all suffused with clear melodious prayer,

transliteration: zangdok pal gyi ri né pema jung
english: As you approach, Padmākara, from the Copper-Coloured Mountain,

transliteration: pawo khandrö tsok ché dir shek la
english: Surrounded by hosts of ḍākas and ḍākinīs.

transliteration: sal sal ku yi nangwa mik la tön
english: Your body—vivid, clear—appears before my eyes;

transliteration: nyen nyen sung gi chö dra nawar drok
english: Your melodious dharma speech is pleasant to my ears;

transliteration: lhö lhö tuk kyi jinlab nying la tim
english: Your mind’s soothing blessings enter my heart.

transliteration: jin chen pob la wang zhi kur du sol
english: Please bestow your great resplendence and grant the four empowerments!

transliteration: ngön lé lhasin trukpé tral kyen gyi
english: Agitated gods and demons from the past

transliteration: mi chukné rim sé ser ul zhing pong
english: Cause diseases, calamities, poverty and destitution

transliteration: chok zhi maktruk tsönché kalpa sok
english: for men and beasts alike.

transliteration: malü zhi zhing dokpar jin gyi lob
english: In these times of warfare, with enemies all around,

transliteration: charchu dü bab lo chuk taktu lek
english: Bring timely rain! Let crops and livestock thrive!

transliteration: tsering nemé lü ngak yi sum dé
english: Grant long life, without disease; set body, speech and mind at ease!

transliteration: ta zhi jorpé lé go nampar ché
english: Open the gates of fortune in all directions!

transliteration: dzokden gatön gyepar jingyi lob
english: Bless this golden age, that it may grow, in endless joy!

transliteration: bö bang namyang yalwar mi dor zhé
english: Your pledge to the king, to the prince and subjects—

transliteration: ngadak yabsé bang la zhal chepé
english: That you never would abandon the people of Tibet—

transliteration: gyurmé dorjé sung gi dön gyi dré
english: This is the fruit of your unchanging vajra-speech.

transliteration: ngönsum tsolwé gatön dü la bab
english: Let us celebrate this feast of your promise coming true!

transliteration: dorna deng né lhündrub kuntuzang
english: From this day forth until my effortless attainment

transliteration: ma tob desi gönpo khyö nyi kyi
english: For as long as this takes, my sole protector,

transliteration: jesu zung né chok dang tünmong gi
english: Care for me, I pray, and keep me sated

transliteration: ngödrub dütsi chü kyi tsimpar dzö
english: With the elixir of the amṛta of supreme and common siddhis.

transliteration: gyal kün düpa ngayab lingpa yi
english: May the sunlight of compassion from Ngayab Lingpa,

transliteration: tukjé nyimé ö kyi tsün lhé mün
english: Who embodies all the victorious buddhas, bring an end

transliteration: tar jé chimé drubpé pen dang dé
english: To the darkness of ancestral deities and may the sublime light

transliteration: nangwa dampé kham sum yong khyab shok
english: Of the happiness and benefit of immortality fill the three realms!

transliteration: tanyé do ngak zhungluk gyatso ché
english: Skilled exponent of the vast, oceanic scriptural tradition

transliteration: ma khé ngak gi wangchuk chö nam la
english: Of sūtra and mantra, a lord of speech with mastery

transliteration: ché tsö tsompé pal gyi wangjor ba
english: Over the glory of explication, debate and composition—

transliteration: jikten mik chik kal gyar zhabten shok
english: Sole eye for the world, may your life remain secure for a hundred aeons!

transliteration: drubdé gyé dang bar mama ning sok
english: May the oceanic hosts of yidam deities—the eight great sādhanas,

transliteration: yidam chösung gyatsö tsok nam kyi
english: Gönpo Maning blazing in glory and the rest—and dharma guardians

transliteration: rikdzin chöjer ngar gyi si ngen kün
english: Utterly pacify any demons afflicting this vidyādhara lord of Dharma

transliteration: rabzhi yungdrung tabur tenpar shok
english: And ensure that his life is as stable as the everlasting yungdrung!

transliteration: hung, zhi ying gyurmé chökü long yang né
english: Hūṃ! Out of the unchanging space of the ground, dharmakāya's vast expanse,

transliteration: tsalnang gakmé dorjé purpé lha
english: You manifest unimpededly as its dynamic power, deities of Kīlaya—

transliteration: yingrik yermé torma di zhé la
english: Please accept this torma of indivisible space and rigpa,

transliteration: trulnang ne dön dra gek ying su dok
english: And dispel all delusory appearances, sickness, harmful influences, enemies and obstructing forces into all-pervading space!

transliteration: drang yé kalpar tukkyé lek gompé
english: Having perfectly meditated upon generating the enlightened mind for incalculable eons,

transliteration: tayé drowé rekong damchö char
english: The incomparable sovereign of the Śākyas wisely brought down the rain

transliteration: beb khé nyammé shakyé wangpo yi
english: Of sublime teachings in order to fulfill the wishes of illimitable beings.

transliteration: dro di gelek pal gyi kyang du sol
english: To you who protects beings through glorious virtue, I pay homage!

transliteration: rim sum chö kyi khorlö gongpé dön
english: The intended meaning of the three successive Wheels of Dharma

transliteration: khé dang drub nyé dumé tralwa lé
english: Was explicated from multiple realizations derived from study and practice.

transliteration: chö kyi go mang rab yé yagyal chik
english: This is what distinguishes the one from the many gates of the Buddha's Dharma.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: gangjong gyalten pemé tsal yangpor
english: Amidst the vast lotus grove of the victor's teachings in the Land of Snow,

transliteration: shedrub chö tsul dabgya drolwé trö
english: Hundreds of petals of Buddhist exposition and meditation systems bloomed.

transliteration: khorlo tamé gongpa tsal tönpé
english: Among them, the dynamic intent of the final Wheel of Dharma was revealed.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: dogyü zhen dang shé sol midrawé
english: You uphold and transmit an unparalleled oral transmission,

transliteration: shingté sol chen dü kyi khorlö gyü
english: A commentarial tradition distinct from other sūtras and tantras

transliteration: mi nyam dzin ching pelwé kabab pa
english: On the great chariot tradition of the Kālacakra Tantra.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: yumo mi kyö dorjé né zung té
english: From Yumo Mikyö Dorje, through Dolpopa,

transliteration: dol buwa dang kün ga drolwé chok
english: Kunga Drolchok, the protector Jetsun Tāranātha,

transliteration: jetsün drol gön sok kyi lek pelwé
english: And successive masters, your lineage has gracefully disseminated.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: nyingpö do dang ludrub zhung gi dön
english: The timelessly ultimate residing, stable, enduring

transliteration: zhi dré yermé takten deshek nying
english: Enlightened essence is the indivisible ground and fruition.

transliteration: yené zhukpé döndam drelwé tsul
english: This is the way elucidated in the Essence Sūtras and the meaning beheld by Nāgārjuna.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: do yi tawa zhen tong uma dang
english: Your Middle Way zhentong view of the sūtras

transliteration: gyü dön naljor druk gi nyamlen gyi
english: And your practice of the Six Yogas which unfolds the meaning of the tantras

transliteration: chöku ngön du dzepé zhé sol ché
english: Are great traditions of explanation that activate the actual dimension of reality.

transliteration: jonangpa yi tenpa gyé gyur chik
english: May the teachings of the Jonang flourish!

transliteration: kyabné gyal dang gyalsé jin chen dang
english: Through the great blessings of the sources of refuge, the victor and the victor's children,

transliteration: chönyi döndam gyurwa mepé tob
english: Through the power of the unalterable ultimate nature of reality,

transliteration: karchok lha dang dakchak mögü tü
english: Through the force of divine virtue, and through our devotion,

transliteration: mönlam di tab jizhin drubpar shok
english: May this aspiration prayer be fulfilled accordingly!
